description:
In San Francisco again in search of where to have dinner. Found Matador on Yelp and glad we did. 

The food was deliciously authentic. I had a carnitas taco and pozole. My friend had a taco al pastor and pozole too. She totally agrees with me, the meal was outstanding.  Of course she had to have a Tequila Flight that  turned out to  be both an educational and very nice experience. Although the 1 2 3 reposado, that up to now has been her favorite,  it was outshined by the Fortaleza, a peppery surprise. 

The dinner  wonderful, the service impecable.  When in San Francisco will return. Who knows, we may be back before we go back home.
author: Teresa F.

description:
Margaritas were delicious. Tacos, chips and guacamole were also delicious. And our waiter was great.

Unfortunately, the total buzzkill was being asked to quickly pay our bill and leave cause "people were waiting for our table." Whoever came by was the manager or owner (someone who worked there who was not our charming waiter). It was 7:30pm on a Monday night and my friend and I had been there for only 1 hour and spent over $100. This was not the service we were expecting. Unfortunately, I will not be returning.
author: Savannah L.

description:
Decent place to grab some Mexican food. The portions are a bit small for their apps and their tacos so you`ll probably be full after spending over $30. I had the enchiladas this time and it was just your typical salsa verde with shredded chicken inside. Nothing spectacular.

The mimosa`s were great! Really strong and had some great flavour though :)
author: Taylor Z.

description: If you're looking for an authentic Mexican restaurant in SF, this is not it. Let me start with they do not customize anything. It is like everything is premade. They couldn't even add a different dressing to a salad. My 8 year old brother wanted his bistek tacos without onion && they couldn't even remove the onion (long pieces of grilled onion) The al pastor was undercooked. The "shrimp a la diabla" was literally shrimp grilled with seasoning. No diabla sauce. The bottled Mexican drinks were hot && the tortillas were soggy. So disappointed. Read all these reviews and couldn't believe that people actually thought it was good. Super over priced for the quality never again.
author: Yaya G.

description:
Not for prime time, Matador is right for a Happy Hour margarita on your way home or on a break from Union Square shopping on the weekend. 

Happy Hour DAILY 3-6

Chips & House Made Salsa $1HH is great. While I'm a firm believer this should always be free in a proper Mexican restaurant, all pay a buck for these salsas. And almost, pasta sauce sweet but with the pepper taste you expect. This ones easy. The orange, habanero salsa is not spicy but a slow burn that's great with a margarita back. The pico is perfectly basic. Mix in a little with your favorite of the other two for a great blend. 

Small Ass Tacos, 3 for $11! Really? These are barely $2ea size in a street size tortilla. Does the meat make the taco worth the price? Not the barbacoa. It's dry inside despite being soaked in sauce. It dropped all over the plate as I crewed through the taco. 

How about that house margarita $5HH? It's ok. Better for the happy hour price. 

This bright and airy taco stop seats about 12 at the bar, another 4 at the back bar and tables for 25-30. It's loud and causal. This is where you come for a HH margarita or three, ships and guacamole $5HH on your way home or for a late lunch. Not a place for full price anything.

They do have a frozen margarita machine and good selection of tequila. So they have that going for them. Which is nice.
author: Mark F.

description: Nice Vibe, good food and great margaritas made authentically.  Not your margaritas made with triple sec or sweet n sour.  I enjoyed the mole enchiladas very tasty and nice portion size. tacos looked good too! Stay thirsty my friend!  Definitely make a visit here when in SF.  Right around the corner from the JW Marriot
author: Alex L.

description: I fell in love with this little place. One day I ordered the cóctel de camarón and another time I went I ordered the al pastor pork tacos. Both are amazing. The al pastor taco...WOW. I was not expecting the flavors to blend so well. It left me wanting more. If I didn't order the tacos to go I would of probably ordered more. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The service was also speedy.
author: Daisy T.

description:
Stopped in after looking at a few other places in the area. The food was so flavorful, not spicy but flavorful. Small establishment but the decor and quaintness of it made it that much better. The Esquinte appetizer was outstanding. The red sangria has a strong pomegranate and grapefruit flavor. 

Don't miss this place when you visit this area.
author: Alicia S.

description:
Service - *****
Taste - ****
Interior - ****
Price - $$$

I went to lunch. Less people were there than the evening rush. 

A friendly server guided and gave me a lunch menu. I ordered two tacos and a drink for a lunch menu for a cheaper price than the evening price. The server recommended a margarita and I believe her. 

The taste of the taco and margarita was good. Nacho and Gukamona, the newly made services, also tasted fantastic. I was curious about the taste of churros here. I ordered churro and it was great too!!
author: Da Won L.

description: This restaurant is a very trendy SMALL place. I must say though...I'm a fan. Great tacos and drinks. Came here for a late lunch, so it wasn't busy. Guac was tasty. Service was pretty good...no complaints. I loved the shrimp tacos I got...I would recommend them. (Unless you are a vegetarian...then I'm sorry) Slightly expensive, but that is expected for anywhere in SF. I'll be back.
author: Olive R.

description:
TWO WORDS.

FISH. TACOS.

Hands down probably one of the best fish tacos I've ever had!

The service was great as well!

Would definitely come back here again if I'm ever in San Francisco!
author: Belle L.

description:
I came here with a coworker specifically for the happy hour deals, and we were pretty happy with what we got! The $5 house margaritas were pretty good, and strong too.

We started off ordering the salsa ($1) and queso fundido ($5). Both were just okay in my opinion. The salsas were interesting, flavor-wise, but nothing memorable or really delicious. The chips were a little thick for my taste. The queso fundido wasn't what I expected - it was heavy on the veggies, especially mushroom, and I wanted a little more cheese than just the melted layer on top.

We also ordered two tacos to share, and those were better than the apps. It wasn't the best carnitas taco I've ever had, but it was pretty good. Overall, a solid spot, especially during happy hour, but not my first choice.
author: Kristin W.

description:
Bravo Matador! I am a BIG fan. Since we were in California, we wanted to make sure we indulged with some Mexican food. We found this place on Yelp that was near the bar we were and that there was a check-in offer for free chips and salsa. Score. 

We were greeted and seated right away without reservations for a group of 5! The server saw I was bringing up yelp and immediately grabbed our waters and chips and salsa. It came in a trio of a smoky chipotle, pico de Gallo, and a tomato based salsa. DELICIOUS. We also tried the guacamole alongside the salsa and we were not disappointed. You can tell that it was made with fresh ingredients. Ok, I'm raving already and those were only the appetizers. 

Did I mention that it is also a tequileria? Yeah, I'm mad I didn't know such heavenly places exist. They had options for tequila flights that looked appealing, but thought I should try one of their margaritas. I had their hibiscus margarita and it was totally awesome. My gal pals enjoyed the pomegranate and classic and also were pleased. 

Now on to the main meals. The street tacos were enjoyed by our party. The meats were flavorful and tender. I enjoyed their pozole which is a traditional Mexican soup and reminiscent of my Abuelo's own. 

Overall, the food was fantastic and the service was so accommodating and hospitable. Next time in San Francisco, I'll have to return to Matador!
author: Avelina A.

description:
Solid brunch spot!  Ordered the red and yellow micheladas, the mexican corn, el pastor tacos and the huevos rancheros.

The red michelada was way better than the yellow one. 

The corn was super cheesy/saucy.  I am used to having it be more roasted corn and less messy.

The tacos were really good and the huevos rancheros were tasty.  

We sat at the bar which made the service quicker because we just ordered with the bar tender and sat next to the kitchen.  

I'd go back and try some other dishes though!
author: Kimberly L.

description:
We found this place by chance on a Tuesday night. This is a no reservations restaurant and we did a walk in and got a seat almost immediately! 
We had the queso fundido to start with and it was GREAT! We had White Sangria and it was yummy (yummily dangerous) lol 
I ordered the 2 tacos - prawns and we had the churros for dessert.  I thought the churros were pretty hard. So I'm not a fan of their churros! 
Service was great!
author: Kelly L.

description: Love the food and vibe here. Owners super friendly. Best part is the food is delicious!
author: A L.

description:
Tip: Try the michelada with mango puree.

Came in on a whim because we were in the area after a play. It sounded good and had a really nice modern ambiance. 

The ambiance is a hip, upscale, modern taco bar. It is somewhat minimalist decor and has a quite fresh feel to it. The street wall is all windows which they opened to give it a more open setting as well. While that is nice, it also brings the noise level up.

They have a lot of smaller tables and some bar spots, may be tougher for a group of 6+.

The staff was really nice. I made a mistake when I ordered the queso fundito and didnt catch it had chorizo and they politely resolved it. 

The food was good. Only maybe 2 vegetarian options which was a bit disappointing but Im sure they would have made something else veg for me if I asked.

They have a full bar and drink variety. And very reasonable. $7 for a michelada is nothing in the city.

Would def go back if I was in the area.
author: Sean M.

description: We came to Matador on the eve of Cinco de Mayo. It was after work and we needed some pick me up. And boy, did we pick the right place. The atmosphere, the hosts, the food, and the drinks made it all worth it. One person in our party ordered the vegetarian tacos, the other person ordered the soup, and I ordered the salad with steak. They all were happy with their food, but the steak on my salad was so freaking good! Matador exceeded my expectations.
author: Mara M.

description:
We came here with high expectations, but were not impressed.  The food was inconsistent and disappointing.  The service was good, and the setting was certainly modern, upscale, and inviting.

My husband and I shared the following:

1) Salsa trio with chips - this was our favorite dish, shockingly!  We liked the various flavors, and our waiter brought out two extra spicy salsas, which we enjoyed.

2) Camarones a la diabla tacos - tasty; the tacos I liked best

3) Carnitas tacos - way too heavy and intense for me

4) Tacos al matador - the beef on these was dry and flavor combo didn't work 

The service was friendly and efficient.

The location was convenient for us, as we came here after attending an event at the Marines Memorial Theater down the street.  The setting was was modern and not too loud.

Also, the prices are not cheap ($11 for two tacos of the same kind - no mixing and matching allowed) - but then again, this is a upscale, sit down restaurant in SF.

Overall, a decent spot, but we won't be hurrying back.
author: Barnali D.

description:
We stumbled upon this place while shopping one day and we've been back several times! The red sangria is so delicious and every cocktail we've had has always been great. The tacos are hit or miss- carnitas and barbacoa are good size but the fish taco is TINY. We've gotten various brunch entrees and each have been delicious. 

Overall a gem in the union square area! Will definitely be back.
author: Laura M.

description: I was hangry and need some food quick!  Finally decided on Mexican.  Had a margarita and pork carnitas tacos and I was happy.  Check them out if your in the area, near Union Square.  Nice decor, clean and staff was friendly enough.
author: Andrew S.

description: Wow just awesome real Mexican food. Went with a friend who knows her stuff and she ordered up a storm of apps and tacos for our table of four. Everything was delicious and authentic. Everyone enjoyed the food. Definitely not a "tex-mex" place. While everything was great the shrimp tacos were my fav!
author: Chris M.

description:
I've been to Matador a few times. It's always been pretty good! Pretty good margaritas, pretty good food, pretty good space. 

The food isn't even really in contention for "best fancy sit down Mexican food in town", but it's worth the price of admission. The margaritas are fairly priced by the pitcher and strong enough. 

Worth mentioning: The tequila list is pretty deep, and the flights are fun. Solid spot for a low-key dinner. 

Anyway, why four stars? I ordered takeout (which I thought was a risky, because it's not really a takeout kinda place.) I was hungry and I wanted a quesadilla. Got my stuff and headed home.

Dude chased me halfway down the block and across the street because he forgot to give me sour cream. Ran across the street! To deliver a little tub of sour cream! Unreal. What a champ. 

So... here's to you, dude. Sour cream is no joke.
author: Jim M.

description: Good neighborhood spot to go if you're craving Mexican! For my entree I got the Rock Cod Al Pastor, which was what I'd come back for! Loved the pineapple addition. We also got the queso fundido, which was a little disappointing because the vegetable to cheese ratio was about about 5:1, and I was not expecting that. On the plus side, you can 86 da meat, or get it on the side :)
author: Morgyn T.

description: Had dinner here a few nights ago. I ordered a prickly pear frozen margarita, as well as one Al Pastor taco and a Bistecca Ranchero taco. Both were fantastic but a touch soggy so the "taco" part of the meal was difficult to hold, but it was still awesome. Flavours were bright and bold, the pineapple on the Al Pastor was soooo juicy. The marg was amazing and definitely hit me a bit too hard so maybe be careful on ordering a large!
author: Meg C.

description: The decor here was good. We got seated after few minutes of wait. They were quite busy. I felt little hurried to order. Our table was wobbly. We ordered some chips-guacamole, some tacos and enchiladas. The tacos cannot be mixed and matched. That was little annoying. However, the fried chicken taco was good. We filled up on the food enough to not get a chance to try the churros.
author: Tejashree M.

description: Brunch was fun and delicious. The staff is very nice and service is very good. I usually don't eat anything sweet for breakfast. Coffee with cream and sugar is the sweetness to my breakfast. Of course, when I looked over the menu, and I saw French Toast with agave syrup, strawberries, raspberries, and blueberries... well, all of a sudden coffee wouldn't satisfy my sweet tooth. I enjoyed every last bite of my meal. I'll definitely be back.
author: Danielle S.

description:
The very first visit to Matador was a totally random stop in after the Warriors Game 1 in the Finals LY, and was a completely awesome, fun experience. New spot, super fun. Great bartender. Everything. I'd been raving about this spot ever since bc of that time. The bartender was chatting it up w my friends and I the entire time, and was making some great drinks and providing some awesome recos. The drinks were perfectly boozy. The fish tacos were jam packed w flavor. Everything was spot on. 

SADLY, the last two times that I've been here since then, have been exceptionally bad experiences. In fact, the very last time that I went about a month ago was by far the worst. The waitstaff were both neglectful and rude - took over 20+min to take our order and after 30+mins of not getting any of our order, we inquired about our food + drinks, only to be shrugged off. Then, a few mins later, we saw our waitress running out of the restaurant, realizing her shift was over (never told us) and our food + drinks STILL weren't there. Had to flag down who we thought our new waiter was and explain the same thing. Was ignored and shrugged off again. It was pretty sad bc I was literally raving about this spot to the two friends I brought that night. 

We received a half apology about "system error" an HOUR after our order was placed by possibly the manager, who wasn't that sincere about the mistake either. Honestly, it seemed like our original waitress never put in our order bc the four tables who came in after us got ALL their food + drinks within 20mins max. Our two drinks were comped, but the entire experience was unsalvageable at that point. Sad to say, won't be returning again.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Found this place on Yelp. Had the Barbaco tacos, downed those puppies in less than 30 seconds. Talk about moy deliciousoso.... sorry my Spanish isn't as good after a couple margs.

Would definitely recommend to my family and friends. Great happy hour too! Two thumbs up. Would give six stars if I could!!!!!!!!!! Just being real!
author: Alex W.

description: Matador has freaking incredible burritos. Best I've had in the city by a long shot. This review is based on a delivery order (El Puerco burrito + quesadilla) from just the other day and I'm ready for more.
author: Alexander M.

description: The bartender and staff were very friendly! Love the decor. Great margaritas and the Tacos were yummy!!
author: Valetta W.

description: The food is just your typical tacos/brunch there's not much to say about it... the cocktails and the MICHELADAS are the highlights of our meal. Definitely try all 3 flavors. Genius idea!
author: Nathan D.

description:
Some friends and I were here on a Saturday afternoon around 2pm for drinks and a bite, so I can't judge on a full experience but ours was mediocre. Service was horrendous, but it looked like there was only one server working in the entire restaurant and he was also doing host and barback duty. We felt for him and it obviously wasn't his fault, but it was super irritating to have to ask for the same stuff and wait 30 minutes for a beer.  

I was pleasantly surprised that they had 3 different Micheladas on the menu: red (traditional), green (tomatillo based), and yellow which I ordered that had a fresh mango purée and tecate. It wasn't overly sweet at all which was nice. The pork tacos my friend ordered were okay, but not memorable.
author: Lauren M.

description:
Not sure why there are a lot of 4 stars.

Tacos - pricey - 2 for $11 or 3 for $15. Good taste but the tacos are tiny.  Also,  you can't mix and match! This is puzzling and annoying.
Enchiladas - drowned in sour cream. gag. Tex Mex?
Price - good for the enchiladas; not for the tacos
They charge for chips and salsa.
Drinks - ok
Service - good but should be more attentive. They all seemed distracted.
We will not return.
author: Tina C.

description:
First dinner spot while on a work trip to San Fran... this was recommended by a coworker. She said she would have been mad if I didn't try it. The thing that sold me was when she said they have a 1942 margarita!! Love craft cocktails! So she knew how to pull at my heart strings lol. Along with that she said brisket tacos as well. I was sold. 

I decided to try out the Totopus Y Salsa which is a house-made Salsa trio with chips; this was so good. It went from spicy, spicier, to spiciest! For my main course I could not go against the grain so I ordered the Tacos de Matador which was slow roasted brisket in negro modelo, with a spicy mango salsa, and apple and onion slaw. Umm umm deliciousness! The portions were excellent, actually bigger then I thought it would be. These brisket tacos honestly were some of the best I've had in a long time. The portions were perfect. I still am craving those tacos. Great suggestion by my coworker! Now for the main event the Senor 1942 margarita with don Julio 1942, Anejo tequila, orange juice, lime, Cointreau float and agave. Honestly speaking this has to be one of the best of not the best margaritas I've ever tasted. If you are a fan of tequila or not, Don Julio 1942 is the smoothest tequila ever! All in all I had a great food experience at Matador San Fran. Love, love, love - definitely a fan. I will be back as soon as I'm back in San Francisco!!!!
author: Gerard T.

description:
I was tasked with choosing a restaurant to meet my cousin at for lunch in the city on a Friday afternoon. After browsing through Yelp, I decided on Matador simply because of the photos of the decor and drinks. We were lucky enough to find 2 hour street parking (free) 2 blocks away and walked down the steep San Francisco hills to the restaurant on Sutter Street.

What we ordered:
-totopos y salsa (using their Yelp check-in offer)
-guacamole
-enchiladas verdes
-el puerco burrito
-2 yellow micheladas

Everything we ate was delicious and the burrito was huge. We had quite a bit of leftovers, but were very satisfied with our meal. Generally, the atmosphere was pretty chill. There were a few groups who wrapped up their lunch quickly, but most folks in the restaurant looked like they weren't in a rush to get anywhere soon. The service though, was also pretty lax, and could have been more pleasant. Regardless, I would be down to come back for dinner and drinks after a day downtown. Note to the mommies: they don't provide high chairs.
author: Camille B.

description: Nice cozy Mexican spot to pick up a good Margarita and a quick bite to eat. If you check in on Yelp you get a free trio of salsa. I ordered the empanadas and they were just ok, no real seasoning. Their Margaritas I did enjoy. You couldn't taste the tequila which I love. Nice and strong with a refreshing taste of lime.
author: Gina G.

description:
Horrible experience. This was my first place to eat while visiting San Francisco and I would never go back or recommend. We arrived shortly after they opened for the day, only 2/10 tables were taken yet we were sat at the bar to wait for availability. I watched from the bar as the tables stayed empty, our server brought chips and water then never came back for over 30 min until the manager came over to bring us to the 3 top table we were waiting for. In the meantime, other 2 tops came and sat but our party of 3 had to wait until one table in the corner was ready. I guess putting two tables together for a group of 3 was not something they could accommodate. Once sat at the table the staff was even less attentive to us. We didn't get water until after ordering and asking for it. We ordered margaritas for the table, only one came and that was after asking for it twice. 

Now this is where things went really south, if the service wasn't already a deterrent. I got extremely sick from the food shortly after eating, vomiting for 3 hours with a fever and stomach pain (and no I didn't drink because the margarita it never came). 

To wrap up my 1-Star review: Our bill was $130 for just 3 meals and chips and 1 margarita, I experienced the worst service I've ever received and I got horrible food poisoning after the meal. 

Good luck if you go! I wish I could rewind time to not go there.
author: Dillin R.

description: This place was absolutely amazing!! Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. I have severe food allergies and they were very understanding and willing to accommodate. Best Mexican food I've had in a long time and great drinks to go along with it!! I will be back for sure. Thank you Matador!!
author: Amy K.

description:
Went here after a long Day with a coworker and we were starving. 
Ordered some guacamole with chips as an appetizer and a shrimp quesadilla. 

All of the food was quick and fresh but definitely not enough shrimp in my quesadilla.  It probably had 3 shrimps in total.  Couldn't really complain though. 

The atmosphere was super cool and trendy and there was a price for that.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
We've been coming here weekly on Thursdays for ages.  Staff is super friendly, food is amazing, 'ritas are off the chain!
Some of the best fish tacos in SF (borrachos!) Shrimp quesadilla is next level as well.
Never had a bad experience at this SF essential! Hit it up!
author: Samuel S.

description:
Think of a fancy taco spot here, thus the pricey meal. My friend and I split the two orders of tacos ($11), which can be easily turned into two more tacos since they use double tortilla and a lot of meat. We opted for the Tacos De Matador of a roast beef brisket, sticky mango salsa, and pickled onions. This is their most popular taco meat flavor and it was indeed very tasteful and delicious. For more than $5 per taco, it is very expensive. I also had an order of the Equites ($8), which is basically like corn in a cup. The corn was freshly cut off the cobb topped with parmesan, chile and crème. The first half was tasty with the toppings, but then it became just corn and a lot of liquid, which wasn't so great anymore.

With a Yelp check-in, you get a free trio salsa and chips. The chips were crispy and salsa was tasteful. It's a pretty good deal even for the price of $3. The problem was that I still saw the charge for my chips and salsa on my bill and had to request for it to be taken off without even an apology for the mistake. I specifically claimed my check-in with him too! I can see how easily people could be deceived with an order of the chips and salsa without realizing it's not complimentary.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
This was a GREAT place! 
Food, Drinks, the vibe and 5 star service!!
Add this place to your list of Mexican Restaurant when you're in downtown SF
author: Jesse L.

description:
after happy hour nearby, we were hungry. what was left of our group decided to go to matador for dinner. i believe there were seven of us? we walked in on friday, march 2nd around 7:15pm. we didn't have a reservation as i believe they don't take them, but we didn't have to wait long. since our group was bigger, we just had to wait for them to clean off and put together a table that would fit our party.

*totopos y salsa ($3): house made salsa trio and chips 
*guacamole ($10): haas avocado, cilantro, lime juice, pico de gallo
*queso fundido ($11): three cheese blend, hen-of-the-woods mushrooms, chile poblano, roasted corn, house made california chile chorizo
*tacos borrachos - choose either shrimp or fish (+$1): negra modelo battered shrimp with cabbage slaw & mango salsa or battered fish with cabbage slaw, ancho chili aioli, guac & salsa verde (2 of the same taco for $11)
*bistec ranchero (+$1): new york steak, heirloom tomato salsa molcajete, sauteed onions & peppers (2 of the same taco for $11)
*enchiladas verde ($19): salsa verde, grilled chicken, jack cheese, crema, pico de gallo served with rice & beans x3
*classic margarita ($30 pitcher): blanco tequila, agave, lime juice x2
*pomegranate margarita ($12): blanco tequila, pomegranate puree, lime, agave x2
*modelo especial mexico ($6): draft, 16 oz pours
*negra modelo mexico ($6): draft, 16 oz pours

i got the queso and steak tacos. i adored the queso. so cheesy and comforting. and i was happy it came with warm corn tortillas as i am off of deep fried foods and can't eat chips. the tacos were also pretty tasty. the meat flavorful with a nice smoky chew. i actually checked into yelp before we ordered, so we got to take advantage of the free salsa and chips. saved us three dollars. the margs here are potent which i enjoyed. definitely felt the effects by the end of dinner. there was also an order of two tacos in our group which i didn't list above as i have no idea which ones were ordered.

fun spot to feed our bellies after happy hour. i'd definitely come back for that queso and those margs!
author: Elena N.

description:
I just ate here. I come often and bring friends because it's my favorite Mexican in the neighborhood. I tried to use the check in coupon, they marked it as used but left the chips on the bill...... they didn't on honor the check in coupon even though they marked it as used....pissed

Maybe they are pissed that I've checked in 7 times and gotten $21 of free chips... that cost $2 to produce....  my dad says they cost less than 2 dollars to produce but I spend more money on their $5 dollar tacos and $12dollar drinks
author: Annmarie S.

description:
Solid Mexican tapa place. We stopped by here late afternoon and was not disappointed. 

The taco matador (slow roasted beef brisket) and taco barbacoa (slow cooked and shredded beef) are both great. I slightly prefer the latter because the flavor is more intense - love this slow cooking movement applied to mexican cuisine. 

The Pozole (pork and hominy stew) has a twist to it with a chunk of super tender spare rib on top. Make sure that you put in all of the accompaniment (onion, lemon juice, radishes, cilantro) to give extra flavor (didn't care for the cheese element though). 

For the desserts, we liked the Chocolate flan and didn't care for the churros (not fluffy enough and too sweet). 

I also love the airy ambience, tall ceiling, and the striking painting on one side of the wall. Great addition to the tenderloin area which is quickly gentrifying.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Trendy little modern Mexican place in downtown! 

Good service, surprisingly big dishes (3 between 3 people was plenty) and good chips and guac! 

Didn't try the drinks, but I imagine they are great.

Would definitely come again.
author: Aria S.

description: I have never posted a Yelp review until today! I had an outstanding experience at Matador. Both the service and food were incredible. The enchiladas were delicious, and the guacamole is a must have. Definitely recommend this place to both natives and visitors alike.
author: Nicole L.

description:
Pretentious little place. I understand having to wait for your entire party to be seated. However, there are always exceptions to the rule. Asses the situation (party of two) and extend the courtesy. 

I had just gotten back from a trip, long flight I was tired and all I wanted was a nice dinner with my good friend. She literally lives two blocks away from this place.  I asked as a courtesy, if I could be seated while I waited for her and that I would order appetizers and a drink I was craving for while I waited five to ten minutes. I was completely denied first by the host and then by two guys that seems be running this place. There were four tables available; I counted them.

You are not a five star restaurant. People, do your self a favor and go to Colibrí just around the corner on Geary. Way better food more authentic and way friendlier service.
author: Moy V.

description: This is my go-to lunch/dinner place whenever I am in the area. The staff are really great and have accommodated larger groups on many occasions with no complaints, and are always welcoming and friendly. The margaritas, chips and salsa, and carnitas tacos are all favorites that are consistently well prepared. Price and portion sizing feel well-aligned, which is hard to find in a touristy area. Great place for brunch and cocktails too!
author: Kathryn P.

description:
Came to Matador in need of a last minute lunch spot in the area. Mexican food is among my favorite and reviews seemed good. Sold!

We made our way inside and were seated immediately. There seemed to be only one server and it's not a huge joint, but service in general was rather impersonal. He didn't seem interested in telling us a little bit about the menu, answering questions, making recommendations, or getting us our bill (that came later, of course). 

To eat, we ordered chips and guac (as well as salsas which were free with the Yelp check in offer!), and I was hungry so opted for three barbacoa tacos. Everything came out fast, but in general, was lacking severe flavor. The guac needed more salt and was rather bland, while the barbacoa was pretty fatty and dripping in juices that also had no flavor. The salsas were pretty good and I tried to add some of them to my tacos to pump up the flavor, but didn't do much. I will say that the tacos did have a generous portion of meat on them, so just two tacos were enough to fill me up. 

I wouldn't rush back here nor really recommend it to my friends. Maybe some of the other tacos are a bit better, and a different server could've led me in that direction, but this experience just didn't do much for me.
author: Cassie P.

description:
Not all that great. 
Food was cold and the service was colder!! 

The margaritas were weak and watered down

I won't be back.
author: Joshua H.

description:
Really yummy food! Atmosphere and staff wonderful! So much food had to take home leftovers! Enchiladas were swarming in red sauce with melted cheese dripping from
The fork. Loved the addition of pinto beans in the sauce! Will definitely come again!
author: Judith C.

description:
I am updating my bad review. 
So, After being contacting by Matador and receiving a full refund into my PayPal account. I have to say, BRAVO! This is the first restaurant that has offered an actual cash back to us. We order a lot of delivered food from many restaurants, and more often than not it arrives very badly. Yet we might only get a credit of maybe five dollars, maybe more? Matador stepped up and delivered a full cash refund on a delivery 'Grub Hub' screwed up! WE WILL CONTINUE to try new things here with Matador because of this amazing reaction they have had to a problem. Thank you, Matador! Craig.... Like I had mentioned in my complaint review Matador has really fresh and unique food, we just had a bad delivery from Grub Hub.
author: Kirk M.

description:
I'll keep it short.

Great tacos. Amazing cocktails. Service was good but could have been a bit more attentive.

Their salsa? Meh. They charge for more chips? Ugh.
author: Steven G.

description: It looks really good but doesn't taste good. Just know that the food is mediocre and you'll be OK.
author: Brandon F.

description: This place has beautiful decor- I'm a fan of the candlelights and artwork on the walls. I ordered the enchilada verde. It usually comes with grilled chicken but I asked them to replace with shrimp. It was amazing- so delicious and tangy! My friend ordered two shrimp tacos and when they asked if she wants them spicy, she said yes. However they were far too spicy than she could handle and was on fire even after 3 glasses of water. I didn't care try but I'm sure it would've been impossible for me to get thru too.
author: Vyoma K.

description: 2.5 stars!  The drinks were good but I can't say I would come back for the food.  The jumbo shrimp ceviche had a tomato sauce that reminded me of pace pacante salsa in a jar  The yellow rice was super plain.  The tacos and the guac were ok, but nothing spectacular.  Definitely can enjoy more tasty and inexpensive Mexican food in the mission.  I gave it a shot tho and honestly really wanted to like this place...  Perhaps it was an off day?  The space is super cute and the service was good outside of that.
author: Aileen C.

description: Stopped in for a super tasty Margarita made perfectly by our friendly bartender. Went on to have some killer tacos and guacamole. Atmosphere was laid back and fun, and I will definitely return.
author: Lexie G.

description:
3 of us went here for a dinner on a Saturday night.  They sat us against the wall near the bar s they were quite busy. No one seemed to want to service us so we walked up the bar to order our food.  Food took some time to come out to the table.  
Overall poor service for over priced mediocre tasting food.
author: bon-e i.

description:
We placed an order to our hotel and tried the carne asada, assorted tacos and the agave-chipotle ribs. The order arrived very quickly. The ribs were my favorite. They were lean, perfectly smoked and seasoned. A perfect combination of sweet, spicy and smoked flavors. I loved the salad with mango that came with it. Speaking of mango, the carne al pastor taco was delicious with the touch of mango with it. 

My wife loved her carne asada plate. The meat was delicious, the Spanish rice was great as well as the peppers and tomatoes that came with the asada.
author: David O.

description:
Look, I am taking the time to write this review because I can tell that the chefs at Matador are trying to serve up good, Mexican food. However, they fall short on this mission by serving up bland, under-seasoned food that is more comparable to British cuisine than something you would find south of the border. Examples:

1. The Salsa Trio - I would normally ignore the fact that they charge $3 for this despite most good Mexican restaurants in the area serving chips and salsa for free; but the salsas were bland and not spicy at all. One even tasted like it had just been poured out of a jar. Just boring and uninteresting which should not be permitted when we live in a community so rich in Mexican culture and cuisine. There was literally more spice in my lemonade than in the salsa.

2. The Al Pastor and the Matador tacos - Both were under-seasoned and forgettable. Bland and boring, it tasted like the chefs are focused more on catering to the tourist population than actually making good Mexican food. I feel bad saying this because, again, it feels like they are trying. As a neighbor in the community, I really hope this feedback helps. 

I was overly excited to try this place, I really was. The pictures do make the food look good. But don't be fooled, if you care about flavor, I would hold off on coming here, at least for now.
author: Nicolas M.

description:
Pros: 
- Fish tacos are a solid 3.5 / 5 
- Easily accessible from FiDi, SoMA, Union Square, Tenderloin
- Filled with just enough seating that dinner-time really lets you feel like you're in a relatively dense city
- Service is attentive
- 2 well-kept bathrooms

Cons:
- Too expensive for what you get
author: Meryam B.

description: Amazing red sangria and sweet bartender. The tacos were mostly a hit and delicious guacamole.
author: MB K.

description:
Cute spot for Mexican food and drinks. We had the Coctel De Camaron Estilo Veracruz, Pollo Milanesa
Tacos, carnitas tacos and Tacos De Matador. All very good!
author: Jasmin R.

description:
The churros are soooooooo good!!! 

Shrimp tacos were TERRIBLE, too spicy,  (not a good spicy, more like doused on hot sauce spicy) and I live for spicy food. The shrimp it self wasn't grilled, which made it lack flavor in my opinion. 

The chicken milenesa tacos were good! The complimentary yelp check in chips and salsa was amazing

I wanted to give this place 4 stars, but the terrible shrimp tacos are really just that bad.
author: Isha S.

description: Outrageously awesome margaritas and the tacos are even better! Get the guacamole too!
author: John P.

description: Nice Margaritas. The carnitas were fantastic. Friendly place with reasonable prices...
author: Tad M.

description: El Matador is a gem.  From the ambiance of the room to the tasty classic margaritas this is a must eat Mexican restaurant in San Fran.  The chips are hot and toasty while the guacamole is delicious.  Fernando is an excellent host and very attentive.  The music is happening and they project old black and white films above the seating.
author: Levi C.

description:
I have mixed feelings about Matador. The food and drinks are pretty decent, but the menu is pricey, and even the happy hour prices/portions are on the more expensive side.

I originally decided to try Matador after looking through the Yelp page and seeing that they had a lunch/happy hour menu that goes from lunch time to 6pm. Pretty lengthy! I also saw that they had pitchers so of course I was immediately down to try it out.

I came with a couple of friends on a Friday around 4:30, and surprisingly there was no wait. We obviously decided to start off with a pitcher of the Matador Margarita which was tasty BUT be warned this is definitely NOT a pitcher. It comes in a carafe that is of course filled with tons of ice, and once you divvy it up its really only enough for 3 people to have one small glass, maybe a glass and a half. Once you do the math you're really not saving much versus getting your own glass, which is a shame. We followed up with a couple of the Blanco tequila shots and a carafe of the red sangria, which has tequila in it. Trust me they do not skimp out on the spirits in this one as it is pretty strong. Definitely recommend going for the sangria over the margarita if you want more bang for your buck.

In terms of the food, we got an order of the guacamole, which came in what appeared to be a small dish but actually had a lot in it. Then we each ordered a couple of tacos. I got the pork al pastor which was amazing along with the Camarones which was SO spicy. I'm assuming it was something in the mango salsa but even for a girl that likes spicy foods it was way too much for me. I was only able to eat the shrimp which was disappointing. Also, I think the menus in the photo section must be a little out of date, but there's not really a 'happy hour' special price on these with 3 tacos for $10. It's 4.50/taco, and if you want 3 it's $12. Not much of a deal and these are pretty small street tacos so you'll likely need to order more if you're actually hungry.

Overall, Matador is a pretty decent place with really friendly staff and a nice atmosphere, but was just a little disappointing for me as I went expecting something different. If you're willing to shell out $50 for 2-3 drinks and a couple tacos then go for it, but if you're looking for a better deal go elsewhere.
author: Jaymie S.

description:
We came here while visiting a friend in San Fransisco. I got the chicken verde enchiladas. They were very yummy and a large enough portion as to where I couldn't finish. However, they were $19 and comparable to cheaper enchiladas you can find at other Mexican restaurants (I'm from the south and we typically spend about $10 on a similar sized meal). I had a margarita as well. It was good and I can tell it was made with fresh ingredients and not a premade mix. However, I would suggest adding more agave or some type of sweetener. I'm not a fan of super sweet margs, but these were very sour and lacked almost any sweetness. 
Overall pretty good. I would probably go back if I was close by, but wouldn't go out of my way to return.
author: Hilary J.

description:
We popped in for a ladies night with drinks, tacos, and salsa. The place was pretty busy but we were seated right away. We ordered our drinks as soon as we sat down but they didn't come for another 30 minutes. By that time we had ordered and received our food already. We ordered a second round right away. Those drinks also took over 30 minutes to arrive. Someone came by and cleared our table and took our water in an attempt to get us to leave, even though we were waiting on our seconds drinks and still had not received the check. The service was excruciatingly slow and the staff seemed angry. 
In terms of food, the guacamole and salsa trio were tasty. The chips are oily but taste fine. I got the veggie tacos, which were also just very oily. Their flavor was okay but nothing special. Make sure you have a LOT of napkins if you're eating tacos because the oil and juice get everywhere.
The inside is bright and nicely decorated. They have tables for small groups but not big groups.
author: Katie D.

description: This place was so amazing. Great drinks, GREAT food and AMAZING DESSERTS!!! I'm from southern California and have always been picky with my tacos...and everything I tried here was amazing.
author: Erin S.

description: First place we ate here in San Fran and it was great! Leo was our bartender and he so helpful, he definitely made our experience. I came back for their yellow michelada, extra mango. Try the al pastor tacos and the pozole rojo. Their mole sauce is also delicious.
author: Sarahi B.

description: Our first visit here and so very disappointed. From the not so strong $30 pitcher of margis, to the lukewarm food, to literally being asked to leave as soon as we finished our pricey drinks because they needed the table (we saw absolutely NO people waiting), this place was a huge disappointment. Oh, also the server did not check on us at all after dropping off the food. Not once. Next time we are San Fran, we'll hit up another of the tons of choices for dinner. Such a waste.
author: heather w.

description:
Although everything is overpriced, the environment is the reason why I came here. I've watched this place get more and more popular each day, and made a decision to only come here when it's slow. If you eat here and there is a crowd your order has a high possibility of coming out wrong or not at all.

After 45 minutes of waiting I finally had to ask the waiter where my order was because I only had an hour long lunch break. Apparently they forgot about it, so they made in 10 seconds and forgot that I specifically asked for no guac because I am allergic to onions. 

This has happened far to many times. I will never be giving the Matador my money ever again. You've lost me as a customer, and a lot of friends who live in the area. 

To the owner and the girl with the curly hair; 
Tip number one: Treat your customers the way you wish to be treated at a restaurant.

Also, two out of three of your salsas are straight up tomato paste and it's not good.
author: Amber L.

description:
WORST service ever I just wanted to have a chilled Mexican lunch and Joleen A. the waitress/hostess was very rude.  It was an awful experience. 
She was VERY RUDE, inefficient and unapproachable.  Took ages to take my order, to bring water and every time she served something she didn't even looked at me. She even tried to charge me for an extra plate that I didn't have and when I told her she wasn't even surprised, she just didn't care.  The food was overpriced and not that tasty. Do not recommend to come here. Avoid
author: Edna S.

description: Great tacos and good service.  Great happy hour!  Smaller sized portions on some, but worth it.
author: Angelique G.

description:
I had a delicious meal at matador recently and so glad it has opened up in the neighborhood. The whole time this restaurant was being renovated I was peeking through the windows on my walk home to see what was going on and when it would open. Finally, a few Sundays ago the fiancé and I were craving some good margaritas and guac without having to go down to the Mission so we walked down to Matador.

The ambiance inside Matador is nice, fairly small but has a cozy feeling and some seating outside for the nice summer days here in SF.  We posted up at the bar and were immediately greeted by the friendly bartender.  The menu is small but simple, which I like. I feel as if a lot of Mexican restaurants have pages and pages of menu options but here it focuses on tacos and salads with some sides and small plates to share. 

We decided to share a pitcher of the house margarita and started (with yelp check in) free trio of salsas with chips (and added on the guac, duh). The house made salsas and guac were fresh and delicious. Also, the bartender made sure to keep the chips comin when we ran out from snacking away.  Served up with an ice cold margarita, this was a fantastic combo to start the meal. You could tell the margarita has all fresh juices and no yucky sour mix to ruin the quality tequila. For dinner I got the Jicama salad and added tofu (yum), my fiancé got the tacos Matador (beef brisket with mango salsa).  The portions were hearty and satisfying. Everything tasted great and the bartender was quick to check on us, refill waters, get us extra salsa, etc, during our whole meal.

Matador is a fantastic addition to the neighborhood.  I am a huge mezcal and tequila fan and they have probably over 50 varieties to try.  Can't wait to go back and sit outside while sippin on some great drinks and enjoying good food. cheers.
author: Kelsey B.

description: More fusion than traditional Mexican flare, this place is otherwise quite wonderful. The staff are very friendly. The beers and mezcal options delicious... though the mezcal flights were a bit disappointing. The food is tasty with fresh, delicious ingredients. And they have the real hot sauce that will burn your mouth in a good way. May become a regular.
author: Kimberly H.

description: As an update to my previous bad experience: The owner reached out and refunded me from his own pocket so I used that cash to try it again and my order was correct and delicious this time around. I'll definitely be ordering again and it's a good sign to see an owner who cares that much.
author: Randy B.

description:
Nice service, food wasn't great though.

I'm a big authentic mexican snob and got the beef tacos take-out. The meat was eh in terms of quality, lacking in flavors, and had some vegetables sort of randomly thrown in there. By the time I opened my take out it was INCREDIBLY saugy (after only 25 minutes post-pickup).

I came here with high expectations, but the food was just not all that good.
author: Grant R.

description: The food is ok. I find it odd that, whether or not it's hipster, Mexican food with a "twist" that this place doesn't let you mix different kinds of tacos. The service was good, Especially considering we walked in at about 40 minutes to closing time with a rowdy two-year-old. The guacamole needed more salt, lime, spices maybe.  The braised beef (?) tacos I had were ok, not outstanding. The meat was too plain. The michelada i had was ok too. Not terrible, though I did find the addition of artificial celery flavor a bit odd, but not great either. Quite frankly the food wasn't great and overpriced but the service was really good and the restaurant looks cool.
author: Tony C.

description:
Really disappointing experience. The taco menu is confusing and requires you to order in minimums of 2s or 3s, all of the one kind of taco. 'NO MIX AND MATCH' is the eloquent message to patrons atop the menu. 

The service is slow, for a small venue, and arrogant.

And the tacos didn't even taste that nice.
author: Hugh M.

description:
This place was a disappointment. I should have payed more attention about the other reviews that state how rude and pretentious the service is. Also, the food was not good. It's all true.

Our appetizers were dropped off at the wrong table by one of the food runners (chips & salsa, esquite). Not a big deal, it was a mistake. However, the waitress goes up to that table and very rudely and loudly asks the couple "did you guys order this food? is this your food? this belongs to another table, it's not yours" 
They looked very embarrassed (a lot of people turned around and looked). Seriously... it was chips & salsa and a really small plate of corn.. maybe they thought this was normal and part of the meal (you know, like a normal Mexican restaurant).
So she takes the food away from them. Really? They already started eating it. Just let them have it instead of throwing it away. 

Later, she was being very condescending towards the couple sitting to our other side. They seemed to be tourist. I'm not sure what happened there, but she ended up saying something along the lines of "this is how we do it here" (implying, this country). Rude. 

Ok, about the food.
It sucked. Soggy tacos.. the drinks? Meh.
I will never stop here again.
author: Fernando B.

description: I had been wanting to try this place for a while after hearing such good reviews; thankfully, it did not disappoint. We got the salsa trio (free with Yelp check-in) and guacamole. All the flavors were on point and everything tasted very fresh. I also got the prickly pear margarita (2 actually) which packed a decent punch. For food, I got the carnitas tacos. The pork was tender and juicy, and the tacos were small enough to be filling but not leave you in a food coma - the perfect combination. The waitress was friendly and we were seated right away even on a Saturday night. I'll definitely make this place a staple on my list!
author: Pooja C.

description: I got the trio salsa and chips, 2 of the 3 were too spicy for me but had good flavor. Chips could use more salt. Ordered 2 tacos, a bistec (flour tortilla) and carnitas (corn tortilla.) The tortilla size is very small but overflowing with filling.  I ate with fork for a while.  They are a little runny so they are messy to eat. I preffered the carnitas, the bistec had a spicier sauce and peppers.  It's a small place, not very good for large groups. Good quaity food.
author: Jenne S.

description:
I'm pretty sure I just got the wrong thing but I got enchiladas and they were the worst enchiladas I ever ate.  It tasted like boiled chicken as the filling and it wasn't baked in the sauce so the watery, green liquid was just sitting on top of the dry corn tortillas and then cheese was melted on top.  The verde sauce also didn't taste like anything.  The rice wasn't good.  Beans, nope.  I only ate what I did because we hadn't eaten all day.  The server said people love those enchiladas.  I didn't. 

The tables are sat very close to each other so it was slightly uncomfortable.
author: Casey S.

description:
Unfortunately, i have to say that after 4 or 5 wonderful visits to this place I'm never going back there again. 

It's all about the service and it's really bad at Matador. I was there with my friends on a Thursday afternoon and we barely stayed there for an hour. However, our waiter (manager?) was very obvious in his attempts to empty the table for other customers. When he brought the check while we were finishing our drinks, he said plainly that 'there are people waiting for a table'. It seemed weird and inappropriate, but just when we were signing our receipts and calculating tips, he came back and said that 'it's been a while, people are waiting'. It pissed me off! I work in customer service myself and that's what is utterly rude and impolite to say the least. And in my defense, when I first tried out Matador I had to wait for a table for more than an hour and a half and I WAS patient. But I'm not going to put up with the hideous attitude and service to customers.

On top of all that I found out that even though we paid in split with two cards, each (!) of our bank accounts was charged the full price. Pardon my French, but wtf???

Good food and drinks are not able to outshine your service, sadly
author: Nastia S.

description:
Met 2 friends here after work. Atmosphere is fun. But waitress was obviously unhappy with us when one member of our group didn't like her dish and asked for something else. Waitress wanted her to order without showing her menu again - and then came back to our table to tell my friend she'd have to order 2 tacos - not 1 - as they were now serving dinner. When friend said 'never mind' / 'skip the taco' the waitress suddenly decided my friend could have just one taco. There was no minimum order on menu and tacos were priced individually. 

Plus, even though there were only 2 tables with people at them, our drink order took so long to be delivered that frozen margarita was melted. We won't be back. 

I 'checked in' on Yelp and when I asked waitress if that meant they would knock $3 off price of chips we ordered, she said 'no.' We had to have ordered the base chips with salsa ($3) not the chips with guacamole ($10). I thought I indicated we'd like to have the chips and salsa but they never came.
author: Pat S.

description:
Food and drinks are perfect unlike the service! It's the most terrible and the rudest ever!! If you have finished your meal you'll be asking to hurry off the table and if after that you do not leave a tip you'll be charging twice!!!

And the most offensive is that I'm not the only one with such a review..
author: Daria D.

description: Great food and great service. Coctel de cameron and pozole are great. Also, try the spicy margarita.
author: Rob B.

description: The enchilada plate and chicken quesadilla were really good. The breakfast tacos were above average. The Mexican rice and their Pinto beans were just average; no real taste. The free chips when you check in were good and the salsas were also good. The decor was good.
author: Ricky P.

description:
Went here for dinner on a Sunday evening with my boyfriend and the first thing we see is the tables are seated so close together that you are practically dining with the patrons next to you.

We order guacamole and they bring us salsa and chips. it's still fine.

the food is ok; nothing to rave about considering the reviews. 

then it starts getting ridiculous when someone who appears to be a waitress is helping the table next to us and while i am speaking with my boyfriend and maybe i was loud but she looks at me for like 2 minutes and then proceeds to come in between the tables and like puts her back towards me. at this point i feel mildly uncomfortable and offended but whatever maybe i was loud. 

then we receive the bill and they overcharged us for a flight of tequila. it was only a $1 but why? like that is shady so just to let them know we asked them. at this point the same waitress bumps into my boyfriend and stands there and just stares at us and then starts asking us all if we want to order etc.. i tell her no we are asking about our bill. she begins to sounds belligerent and like starts touching my boyfriend and getting in his face. it was so strange.

she made us both feel so uncomfortable i finally got up to handle the bill at the front when she proceeds to start asking my boyfriend his name and other incoherent nonsense. he goes up to the front to ask why this woman is like following us around and management didn't do anything really.

i wanted to just leave so we proceed to and this psycho follows us OUTSIDE the restaurant...??? it was so unprofessional and uncalled for. this isn't a bar on a saturday night...it was 6 pm at what i thought was a classy restaurant. she like touches my boyfriends jacket telling him to have a good night where we both were like can you please leave us alone.

i have never had such a horrible restaurant expe
author: Hibz M.

description: Super unique taco place!! The al pastor tacos were super juicy and there's a chicken taco that's so delicious. Can't wait till the next time I go back!
author: Yoon P.

description: We went here with a large group (7 of us) on a Friday night. Surprisingly, they were able to accommodate us with minimal wait time. That's about where the good news ended though. The food itself was decent (5 of us got different tacos - right from the beef to carnitas to the diablo shrimp). Portions overall were tiny and  we were annoyed that you were unable to mix and match tacos. I also had a spicy margarita - which the waiter insisted I would love if I liked spicy food. The drink itself was average though - the rim was supposed to be chili (I assumed this meant a tajin rim but it was more salty than anything). What really drives the 2 star review though is the service and the prices. $12 for 2 tiny, purely mediocre tacos? Not worth the price.
author: Sam M.

description: Price was a lot for two tacos, that weren't that good. The drinks were too sweet and the salsas has no taste. I won't be going there again. Thank god I didn't pay for the food.
author: Christina L.

description: Perfect spot for our quick visit to the City. Enjoyed some quenching margaritas and tasty bites at the bar. The staff was friendly and provided good service.
author: Matthew D.

description: Lousy take-out.  Tired after a long trip and decided to order take-out to be picked up at 5:15.  It seems as if it was prepared at 4:30 as both dishes were cold and dried out.  We ordered quesadillas that had they been warm might've tasted good but the 3 tacos looked like 3 small piles of dried out beef jerky.
author: Toni L.

description:
Matador is a very sleek and ultra modern little restaurant that specializes in excellent margaritas and various street tacos. I came here on a whim after deciding that I didn't want Italian food for dinner (we had reservations across the street). 

We were seated immediately and I checked in on Yelp to discover that we could get free chips & guac (with an order of an entree)! Great start so far... we ordered a pitcher of the Matador margarita, my sister had the reposado tequila flight, and we ordered the following:

Costillas Con Chipotle Agave ribs - delicious, falls off the bone, melts in your mouth. I could've had a plate of these for dinner by itself. Add a side of arroz & frijoles, and you're straight.
Barbacoa tacos - not being a huge fan of barbacoa, these tacos were pretty good. I added some of their hot sauce (I think it was habanero) for a little kick. Beware, the hot sauce is spicy as hell!
Carnitas tacos - good but not very memorable. 
De Filete (steak) tacos - my least favorite of all the tacos. I didn't like the salsa casera that they put on the taco. 
Al pastor tacos - this must be a new dish since I don't see it on their menu online... nice sweet & smoky flavor, I think their hot sauce comes on the taco, so you've been warned.
Matador margarita - excellent! Tasted really fresh, clean, and STRONG. Good deal at $30/pitcher since you get about 4 glasses out of it. By the glass is $12.

Service was pretty good for the most part. Our servers rotated between a female and a (super hipster) male and while they were both nice, the service just seemed very..... brusque. We were interested in dessert and had to ask when our check was brought out; we wanted to share some flan and our server asked us which one out of the two - uhhh I don't know, can we see the menu again?? After debating between the mezcal and guava flan, turns out I didn't really feel like flan after all. It could've been the feeling of being rushed that turned me off, to be honest. But it wasn't anything serious either.

If I find myself back in the neighborhood, I would totally come back to Matador for the excellent margaritas and work my way through the other tacos on the menu. The ambiance is nice enough to just sit back and enjoy drinks, too.
author: Julie B.

description: The Matador has one of the best red micheladas in San Francisco . The esquite appetizer is a must have . I also ordered the barbacoa tacos and the flavor was great . I didn't enjoy the multiple salsas w/chips and salsa order just keep it simple with one salsa that tastes good .
author: Adam M.

description:
First visit to San Fran and my husband and I stumbled upon this GEM! 
We were greeted promptly by a WONDERFUL gentleman waiter named Pablo! 
Great place, very clean, and great environment. We sat outside on the patio with beautiful chill music, like Michael Buble and Bing Crosby while drinking one of the BEST pitchers of margaritas ever.. made by Pablo himself. You think he was the owner he was so heart felt and passionate about the place.
The menu and foo (even the chips and 3 salas and guac) were amazing, and authentic and prices were very reasonable.
Thank you and see you next time!
Have already recommended it to others!
author: Alishia V.

description: Tacos al pastor and house margarita were both fantastic. Super friendly bartender and waitstaff.
author: Carla S.

description: CINCO DE MAYO!! Great vibe, all staff so friendly and the noise level was tolerable!  Margaritas were good, we ordered classic margaritas so they were just right. The star of the evening was the queso fundido. It came with 6 small tortillas and was amazing with loads of chorizo, mushrooms, roasted corn and peppers. The pork al pastor and beef tacos were good but a bit dry. Had I known I would have had a second order of queso fundido.
author: Carrie B.

description: We walked into this place based on Yelp Reviews, on our way to the SF Playhouse. The food and service was excellent. We all cook, so the bar is high to impress us.  Of note: the posole, huevos rancheros , the salads. Good bar  with Tequila. We were very impressed!  We will be back again.
author: David B.

description: Walking around starving, trying to find a brunch spot. We saw a sign that said tacos so obviously we crossed the street to check it out. The sign out front made me laugh, the menu made me hungry. Then the bloody Maria made me sing. We ordered the street corn appetizer, chilaquiles, and barbacoa tacos. It was all delicious!! Soooo Happy we stumbled into the little gem!
author: Melissa R.

description: Damn your magarita so good!! I don't know what I ordered, but the bar tended made me something off the menu. They know what they doing.
author: Carlos S.

description:
Date & Time:  Sunday March 6, 2016 @ 1:30pm
Location:  Formerly Sugar
Dining Companions:  Husband & Doggie
Scene:  Couples & Groups in Off-the-Shoulder Sweaters & Skinny Jeans Tucked into Hunter Boots
Music:  Dance 
Decor:  Modern, Cozy, Fun.  Bar, FirePlace, Bench-Seating
Service:  On-Point, Friendly, Cute Guys
Imbibe:  Strawberry Lemonade & Pineapple Press
Devour:  Pozole Rojo, Chorizo+Eggs, Carnitas Tacos, Guava Flan
Total:  $46.37
Note:  Brought to You By the People of Huxley
author: Genevieve Y.

description:
Had a great dining experience at El Matador. We order carnitas tacos and shrimp tacos. Los Tacos had excellent quality ingredients which Translate in to an excellent dish.
Service was friendly and helpful and also accommodating to us having a low level of tolerance for spicy food.
For dessert we had caramel flan. If they would have had coffee to go along with the flan I would have given this place five stars. Nevertheless we had a great meal and a very nice experience.
author: Andres M.

description: Love matador! It has such a cool atmosphere, really good tacos, and nice waitstaff. It's close to union square, but isn't overrun with tourists. Would definitely return.
author: Jenn A.

description: The food was super delicious. I had the barbaco taco andA bit pricy for what we got though.
author: Ann L.

description:
Authentic, amazing SASON! This amazing place gives that Homemade feel! It literally makes it feel like if Grandma just made you dinner! The food has that authentic home made touch and flavors that you will keep coming back for more! You really do pay for what you get and that is top notch Meal! Compliments to the Chef for his traditional home made Sason and family oriented! The staff and bartenders are truly a great asset to this restaurant! My hubby and I felt right at home!!!!
El Matador truly is and will always be our new Home Restaurant when we visit from South California!!!

I truly do recommend this restaurant! Gay Friendly!!!!
author: Jesse G.

description:
Was only there for about 10 min. max and the service was terrible! No one acknowledged my presence as I was standing my the front door facing a sign that said "please wait to be seated" after about 2 min. I walked up to bar and asked if I could order to go and was told "yes" and still no one acknowledged my need to spend my money there. 
So I left, which I'm not to mad about since I did see a huge crushed cockroach on the ground eight in front of the door to the place.
author: Shara F.

description: I tried this place a few weeks ago during weekends happy hour and it was pretty good. I had 2 chicken tacos, a Mexican coke, Spanish rice, and chips and guacamole. We asked for some hot sauce to add a little kick to the tacos and the sauce was superb. The guacamole was also scrumptious. Docking one star because the tacos were tiny and because the service could have been more attentive as there were only a few other patrons there at the time. I will definitely be back if I'm ever in the area. My husband wasn't pleased paying $7 for a small plate of rice, but the rice was definitely yummy.
author: Mani K.

description:
Prickly Pear Margarita Mmmmm! What a cute spot! I ordered the tofu tacos they were delish!
I like the ambiance inside but next time I'm eating at that cool bar. Excellent friendly service and yummy food. And The guacamole was great!
author: Cecilia D.

description: The food was absolutely delicious and the drinks were just as perfect .  The service was amazing; dishes were served as courses were completed, executed to perfection.
author: Alicia M.

description:
Pretty pricey, but good quality. Not recommended for take out. 

For those familiar with the old tenant, Sugar Cafe this place is half the size. A full bar, decent amount of table seating and taco bars make for some pretty smart interior designing. 

Ordered:
Brussel Sprouts - for $8, this was kind of a rip off. Not gonna lie. You get maybe a cup (see picture) worth of sprouts. Sprouts still in bright green form and held its integrity, pretty healthy. They were tangy and spicy with a hint of sweetness. Sunflower seeds with the dish was a nice touch, different. 

Carnitas tacos (2) $11- Came with two corn tortillas, street sized. The pork was very tender and juicy, cut into large inch and a half chunks. Pork had good flavor, would order again.   

Steak tacos (2)$11- Came with one flour tortilla, a bit bigger than street sized. Again, large chunks of meat, and cooked very well. Beef was flavorful and tender. 

I asked the waiter if this was enough for two people and he said it was perfect. Truthfully, I think we could have eaten another dish...and we're not big eaters. Tacos don't come with rice or beans and if you don't order any sides or apps, be prepared to walk out hungry. Meat to tortilla ratio was good, but the tortillas got pretty soggy by the time I brought the meal home and I live pretty close. I'd give this another shot as the quality of ingredients were fresh and the meats were tasty.
author: Michelle C.

description: Went there with my friend and we ordered two lunch special: two tacos, a small really small guac, and a drink. Food is decent but service was quite poor. In door decor is however really pretty.
author: Kira L.

description:
We were thrilled to find a great Mexican food restaurant centrally located in San Francisco by Union Square and the Hotel we were staying in.  We started with the chips and salsa trio and enjoyed them thoroughly.  We are not big fans of heat, so they worked perfectly for us.  We then had the tacos Matador and tacos Milanesa and thought the flavors were very fresh!  We also had a quesadilla which had a nice spin on a classic dish with the tomatoes and mushrooms.  
Overall it was a little pricey but about what I expected for that area of San Francisco.  It was a very clean establishment with very friendly staff.  We enjoyed it immensely!
author: Alan L.

description: Great cocktails, great enchiladas and a really good chicken and lime soup. Good for a group of 2-6 people who want decent Mexican and a great spicy margarita!
author: Peita D.

description:
Totally and completely disappointing! Went here with my coworkers for Happy Hour only to wait 10 mins to be seated by the host  (the place was empty as it was early). The service was most atrocious which gets 1 star!
-Took 10 mins to seat us
-30 mins to get our drinks ordered only because I waved down the waitress
- Never got any water until we asked for it only to get it after a 3rd time asking.  

Final kicker: I was super hungry so I ordered a barbacoa taco and got brought out a fried chicken one. When I told the waitress politely that's not what I ordered, she defensively denied that that what I ordered twice. My coworker even chimed in and said she heard me order barbacoa. I didn't make it a big deal because I didn't want to be seem  as a brat but the gesture to send me my original order would definitely raise my rating here and overall care of the staff.

It seems as if the place was under staffed and/or training new staff. Overall, I won't be back as the service is awful and the food is not that great.
author: Sandra V.

description:
They are doing a lot better than before. It was kind of a mess but this last visit seems like they've worked out some of the kinks & hired new staff. We were seated outside but were not ignored and attended to. Tacos are really good & the white sangria. It's a nice hang out spot in Union Square. 
Tourists: stay away from Powell other than shopping ;p
author: Eryk L.

description:
Still some early kinks but I'll give Matador, and its bougie tacos, the benefit of the doubt if anything for the updates to the former Sugar space.  

Matador has made significant updates to the space but old vestiges like the former fireplace/mantle remain. A huge bar now takes centerstage and they've rearranged the space to presumably fit a full kitchen in since the former space operated on a camp stove. A clean and contemporary design with lots of natural light make it a delightful spot for lunch. 

It took quite a while to get served once we got seated by the host despite there being a whole host of folks behind the bar. Early kink but our server was attentive once he got to us. Straightforward menu with a variety of tacos and salads. Nice trio of salsas to go with the chips. The New York steak tacos were disappointing. The steak was cooked well but severely under-seasoned. It needed all the extra salsa that we had ordered separately. The ahi tuna taco however was delicious. A wonderful balance of bright flavor and seasoning between the tuna, red cabbage slaw, and avocado. At $11 for two tacos, prices are on the higher end of things. The tacos aren't particularly filling so one order might not be enough so the bill can add up quick.

It's like a Tacolicious by Union Square. Nostalgically, I'll miss Sugar but give Matador a shot especially once they iron out the early details. Otherwise, it's still a nice spot to stop by just for drinks.
author: Jon L.

description:
I am beyond excited to have this place in the neighborhood. When you hear that a place has a frozen margarita machine, you might picture carnival nightmares. Well stop. Because I'm here to tell you that when I saw small chunks floating in my frozen strawberry marg I got kinda scared, and then realized that those chunks were pieces of actual strawberries. And on top of that, they were strong. In my experience, frozen margs are usually sugary, low alcohols content nightmares. Not in this case my friends. 

The guac was great, and the chips were fresh and legit. We had the chicken soup and it was the real deal. It did need a little but more of a spicy kick but that's nothing some hot sauce couldn't fix.

Last were the carnitas tacos. Geezus. The carnitas were SO GOOD. As a girl that has had her fair share of carnitas, these were amazing.
I must admit I like some fattiness to mine, so there was fat but it was the right amount, IMO. 

Service was really friendly and helpful. The space is WAY smaller than Sugar was, but I liked it that way. It's more intimate.

Get the marg with the Coronita in it and celebrate being alive. You won't regret it.
author: Liz M.

description: Yum! Great service! I asked for extra cheese on my quesadilla and they actually put extra cheese. That goes a long way for me. Also, great drinks!
author: Jackie M.

description: 1st the place has nice decor and there is a round bar so it's a great spot for a happy hour drink if you are in the mood for Mexican food. The dishes have good presentation. Unfortunately the taste is not up to par and also just not authentic. The most disappointing part of my meal is that the steak meat is quite chewy. At its core this just does not cut it for a returned visit.
author: andrew v.

description:
I sent the business a message before writing this review. Matador did not reply. 

My boyfriend and I live in the neighborhood. We have eaten here 10+ times, lunch and dinner. We usually order the enchiladas verdes which are pretty good, when the shrimp isn't grey and undercooked.  We've had other questionable visits in the past, ranging from cold food to unfriendly service, but we've been loyal and stuck with it. 

Last Friday night, we came to the restaurant around 9:30, pretty late and the restaurant was busy. We had a small pup with us so we sat outside, which was empty, and situated our own tables and chairs. There were 4 of us. I went inside to let someone know we were out there and to use the restroom. We were not in a hurry and were simply happy to have found a patio with a heater. When I went inside, the waitress (who has served us in the past on empty weekend afternoons) told me there weren't menus available but would bring one out shortly. No problem. After using the restroom I saw a couple had freed up at the front desk, so I took them out with me. The restaurant was full but we deemed to be the only party waiting so we thought it would be ok to wait and sit outside. 

So soon enough, the waitress came out with silverware, napkins and menus. We had already looked over the menu so we were ready to order. She said she'd come back out since they were busy. Again, no problem. 10 minutes later one of our party went inside to ask if someone would be out to take our order. Same waitress said to him, "I'll be out when I'm free. It's busy tonight and you sat yourselves." The tone was rude and insinuating that we should not have come to the restaurant, that we were imposing on her for choosing this place for dinner. We got up and left. 

We have had this waitress before and while we've tolerated it to support our neighborhood businesses in the past, this was unacceptable. She is typically unwelcoming, but last night she was flat out rude and we wont be visiting anymore. We're pretty disappointed because we live in the area and love our local spots.
author: Gabrielle S.

description: This little place is everything! Great for a lil date night or a great time with the girls! The food is delicious! I highly recommend the guacamole and chips, yum yum yum... nice selection of cocktails too... the staff are extremely friendly and very attentive! Beautiful romantic like atmosphere, though you can still laugh away and not worry about disturbing the next table.
author: Dee G.

description:
Matador. Cool ambiance, solid food, I really enjoy the flavors of the tacos matador (I get three and tell my wife I'm a growing boy), and the textures are terrific, so long as you don't get takeout and let it sit for more than about 15 mins....suckers are juicy! The salsas are muy deliciouso, so if you're desperacito for some craft tacos, this is the spot in lower Nob. It is expensive for my taste, but chill date spot with low lights, vintage black and white movies on the wall, and the occasional wild homeless person or, in one case, an uproariously drunk person involutarily playing twister (alcohol 1: dude 0, for those keeping score). 

We'll probably continue coming monthly if we can't budget the calories for a Tacorea Cali burrito (friggin delicious and cheaper for a meal, if you don't count the gym membership required), as a splurge takeout as it's close, and tasty. 

Barbacoa tacos are pretty good, the orange salsa is crackin, and the tacos matador is my go to.
author: Anton L.

description: Good Mexican meals with some veggie options which is always a good thing, service was really fast since I was there quite early. Prices are a bit high but well, you're in San Francisco...
author: David B.
