description: This place is pretty cool. I dig the menu in general but cocktails are still pricey during happy hour. Carnitas taco was ah-mazing.  Love it. Would go back.
author: Brian S.

description: Cute atmosphere! Clean! Awesome service! The food and drinks were excellent as well. Very fresh food and high quality ingredients. I had the chips and salsa trio, corn appetizer, and the chicken and breaded shrimp tacos. I loved everything And I'd like to think I'm a Mexican food connoisseur. The bartender Fernando was super accommodating and great at what he does. I had the jalapeño margarita and loved it. Would definitely recommend this place as they put love and care into what they do.
author: Cass M.

description: It feels so modern and clean. Workers here are all kind and feels trustful. I like Camarones a La Diabla and Carnitas tacos. If you come lunch, you'll get these cheaper!
author: Changmin L.

description:
Bottom Line:  Tasty Mexican food that won't require a post lunch siesta.

Matador was great from start to finish.  For starters, I loved the a-frame sign out front that said something along the lines of "Working out will make you look better but so will tequila."  The restaurant is modern but still has touches of Mexico throughout.  Also, the small restaurant located in Union Square was very clean.

I enjoyed the salsa trio, guacamole and their house salad with shrimp.  I loved that none of the dishes were heavy and the dishes really felt like a cross between Mexican and Californian Cuisine.  The house salad, which is technically called "Ensalada Casera" had a light vinaigrette dressing, plump cherry tomatoes, crunchy pepitas and roasted corn in it.  I think I could eat that salad every day, especially since you can get it topped with different proteins.

At night I hear this place really comes alive but I was glad to have a quiet lunch with my BF and friend.  Overall, this was a great place to enjoy a quiet lunch and next time I will definitely try the tacos.
author: Courtney K.

description: Great service and tacos! We ordered the pollo milanesa and brisket. very good!
author: Jennifer H.

description: Amazing tacos!  My wife, daughter and I tried this place for lunch, and we were all very satisfied.  It was nice that they were accommodating to our 10 year old's taco alteration requests.  The tacos are ordered a la carte, at $4 per taco.  I tried three varieties:  Barbacoa (shredded beef), Taco al Pastor (bacon wrapped slow roasted pork), and the Tacos de Matador (slow roasted beef  brisket).  Each taco was a flavor explosion, but the signature Matador was my favorite. The Matador taco was topped with sticky mango salsa and some apple and onion slaw.  Amazing!  I would highly recommend this place, and suggest that you order a variety of tacos.  There are plenty of choices, so mix, match and enjoy.
author: John M.

description:
Wife and I dined at Matador mid-afternoon in late September.  We were walking near our hotel looking for a late lunch and three things caught our eye:
- A hip menu with quality ingredients.
- Available outdoor seating.  (This was desirable because music blaring inside the restaurant was way too loud).
- Outdoor seating was in the shade.  This was relief on a hot sunny San Francisco afternoon.

I must admit Matador's food was really surprisingly good - 4 stars!  I'm from San Diego so obviously I have exposure to Mexican inspired dishes.  Wife ordered the Pozole which she really loved.  I had two tacos, the Barbacoa and the Carnitas.  Both were good quality and very tasty.
Our server was OK but would be away for long periods.  And again the inside music was too loud but was tolerable outside.  Overall Matador is A-OK!
author: L. D.

description: Fun place for tacos. Good was good, maybe 7/10. Drinks and service were also good, and prices were distinctly reasonable for the area. Only downside is the menu is quite limited, especially for vegetarians. My other veggie friend and I ended up splitting one of the big platters so we could each get some variety which worked out well, but my options would have been pretty boring if I had been solo.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
Fried fish tacos were really good. Steak tacos were pretty good. Trio of salsa was super mild, even though the server told us they were spicy when he brought them. They could definitely kick up the spicy like A LOT. Chips were thin and crispy, pretty good. Guacamole was not great, really runny and bland. Service was ok, not great.

Honestly, I like Chisme Cantina way better.
author: Stomparella J.

description: A good Mexican restaurant if you're in Nob Hill area.  Dined on a week night with husband and daughter.   No waiting to be seated.  We ordered empanadas as an appetizer, and a salad and tacos to share.  All tasted fresh and flavorful. Our waiter didn't hear our order of empanadas so it came out after the entrees, so that was disappointing. Otherwise,  a decent experience.  This area is so touristy that it's hard to find above-average food, but this restaurant rates above avg.
author: Robyn B.

description:
would be 5 stars but their margs are definitely made with some acidy sweet and sour mix that i just couldn't enjoy after one. BUT THE TACOS -

we got pork belly, shrimp & fried chicken. let me just say, that fried chicken taco changed the game. we ordered a total of 9 tacos and a side of guac and chips. i was full after 3 tacos .. like seriously dying so full ready for bed. LOL. 

ive been talking about matator ever since and csnt wait to go back
author: Taylor N.

description: This place was smaller than I thought but the food and drinks are great, great happy hour menu.  It's a good place to go to before catching a show since it's near theaters.
author: a f.

description:
2.5 stars but I'm feeling generous.

My friend and I were seated outside on a sunny Saturday afternoon. Upon sitting down our waiter asked if we wanted to start off with some chips and salsa, which we gladly obliged to as it's free with a Yelp check-in! He brought out guac as well, which we didn't question at the time. We should have, though, because we got charged the $9 for it and didn't order it. My friend and I felt a little ripped off by this but didn't feel like making a fuss about it.

The chips and salsa were good. Each salsa had a strong kick to it. For my entree I ordered 2 al pastor tacos (one pork and one fish) and one spicy shrimp taco. They messed up my order. I ended up getting two fish tacos (I believe one was al pastor and one was a regular fish taco.) Not one out of the 3 tacos had pork in it. However, the regular fish taco was pretty tasty. I enjoyed it a lot better than the al pastor fish taco. And the salsa on the regular fish taco was spiiicy! I was suffering a little. Half good suffering, half in a lot of pain suffering. The shrimp taco was alright. But at $4/taco, I think I'll pass next time and go somewhere else.

To wash down the spiciness I ordered the watermelon agua fresca ($5) which was absolutely delicious! Love that they use real watermelon (for 5 bucks they BETTER). But seriously it was so refreshing. Best thing I consumed here. 

For what it's worth the guac wasn't even that good. Not worth $9. Skip it. Better yet, just go to the Mission for a cheaper and more authentic meal.
author: Cheryl N.

description: We wanted authentic Mexican food during our honeymoon and the food was good and well portioned but I wasn't too impressed. The service was quick but not so much personal and friendly like other places we have experienced.
author: Laura D.

description: Came here a few weeks ago. Wanted something light to eat that night. We were greeted with a friendly smile. Decor is awesome. The place was clean and cozy. The food was the best I've had in some time.
author: Elizabeth P.

description:
SO good. The food and drinks were all amazing. The tacos were great. Our party split a few different types so we could mix and match (one downfall is that you cannot mix and match tacos). The flavors and sauce combinations on the tacos were so unique. 

The prickly pear margarita was to die for. 

After we couldn't breathe any more, we decided to order the churros and I'm so glad we did.

The caramel sauce was amazing.

Definitely recommend for date night or a group night out.
author: Caroline B.

description: Avoid. The person at the door is extremely rude. Sub par Mexican. Never should you have to pay chips and salsa.
author: Shawn M.

description: Since there are way too many restaurants in San Francisco I have made a new rule to not go to the same one twice, however due to the great and amazing service that me and my family receive by Fernando this has been our to go place for food, drinks and of course good service.
author: Paulina C.

description:
If you're going to be a fancy/pricey Mexican joint in a city full of amazing and cheap taquerias you better darned well raise the bar on flavor profiles, ingredient quality and superior service. Otherwise I'll just wait to read the post from SFist announcing your closure while I stuff myself at El Farlito, taqueria Cancun, Pancho Villa or El Castillito. Bye, Felicia! 

Service
Our group honestly thought that we must have somehow done something to offend the waitstaff. We couldn't think of what we'd done but thought there had to be a reason for our waiter seemingly ignoring us multiple times and then just being rude. After reading the other reviews here I realize that it wasn't us - this is just their standard treatment for guests.
Food took excessively long.
When trying to flag our waiter he'd make eye contact but then just walk away -several times.
Used the yelp check in deal for the free salsa/chips and had to remind the to bring it multiple times.
I ordered my fish tacos with the aoli on the side but the waiter told me they actually don't serve the aoli anymore. That's totally fine by me. Except then my tacos arrived covered in aoli. One of the managers did offer to replace it but I didn't want to wait another 30-40 minutes for 2 tacos as my friends would have been done eating before they arrived.

Food
Guacamole - solid. Fresh and full of all the avocadoy goodness that us millinials purchase instead of houses
Queso - don't shame me but I like queso. It might not be Mexican but its damed tasty. Well it should be .. but it's not at matador. Look -this shouldn't be difficult. Take cheese that liquifies melt it, give to me. These guys had piles of mushrooms, big slices of pepper- other random junk. It smelled like a pizza but not as good.
Tacos  - Not bad. All of us said they were good. None of us were blown away. The $7 taco plate at Pancho Villa is significantly better. 

Lastly
Your no mix n match on tacos rule is obnoxious. Not giving the option to just buy one taco of any kind is even more obnoxious fuckery. Pure Fuckery. You aren't good enough to give us taco rules! Your tacos would need to be irresistible for me to overlook this nonsense and SPOILER ALERT: they aren't irresistible.
author: Amber F.

description: We ate at the Matador and the service was a little lacking though the food was good. I had Tacos de Matador and my partner had enchiladas verses. The tacos were good but had too much cabbage and the enchiladas were excellent. They come with rice and pinto beans and are covered in Verde sauce and crema so rich. She had margaritas and I had a white wine blend. We were both happy with our drinks. Dinner was good enough that we'd come back despite the service.
author: Mandy F.

description: If your looking for tacos and a margarita near Union Square, look no further! For drinks I would strongly recommend the Matador Old Fashioned and the house margarita, delicious! The al pastor tacos, included pineapple, but are yummy although not all that spicy. Friendly staff! Table service or sit on the large bar area where you can order food and drinks. I would highly recommended this spot.
author: Maggie S.

description: I don't get this restaurant. They partner with courier services, but are too disorganized to actually accept orders? Last time they were very slow in preparing the order (delayed by 1hr+), and this time they just cancelled the order.
author: Kevin G.

description:
They close at 11pm yet we were turned away at exactly 10:35 pm. It seems insane to stop accepting costumers so early compared to when they close. Most restaurants would accept people until 10:50 if they were open until 11.
Thank you so much for commenting. We actually tried going both Wednesday May 3rd and May 4th. On Wednesday we were turned away at 10:35 and on Thursday we strolled up at 10:40 and could tell we would be turned away since you guys looked even more closed than than day before. I believe you should just change your closing time since your staff doesn't seem interested in being there until 11:00.
author: Beth M.

description: We searched for a taco place on yelp and Matador came up so we decided to give it a try. We were greeted by Pablo who indicated he's manager, busboy, waiter, etc. We decided on the guacamole, one taco al pastor, one barbacoa taco, a quesadilla, and a sopa de rancho. We got the salsa trio and chips for free for checking in on Yelp. The ambiance was chill but it did seem like a cool and busy spot for happy hour and late night drinks. Pablo was very attentive and friendly and made sure we were taken care of. This is especially important because we are traveling with a 16 month-old. The food was great. Pablo was very affable and we will definitely be back.
author: Tere P.

description: We held our company holiday party here. The owner was very kind and accommodating. He made sure we had everything we needed and made it fun by handing out fresh sangria when we walked in and passing out tequila shots. The food was also AMAZING. We ordered 4 different types of tacos, each made with very fresh ingredients and super flavorful. For desert, we had churros with chocolate and caramel sauce for dipping. Fantastic food, great atmosphere, overall a fun experience. I look forward to coming back here for dinner sometime soon!
author: Gabriela S.

description: If you're looking for an upscale, hip Mexican place to eat at, come here. I ordered the veggie tacos which came with tofu, mushrooms and salsa. I enjoyed the mushrooms as they had a hearty, earthy flavor to them but I've had better tacos in the Bay Area. I appreciate the vibe they're going for here but I'm a fan of authentic food without all of the frills.
author: Nicole A.

description: Was in town for work, Matador was around the corner from where I was staying.... wow! Awesome spot! Amazing service from the bartender/owner.. food was super tasty and drinks did not disappoint !!! Thanks again for the welcoming experience
author: richard f.

description:
Matador is the best Mexican restaurant in all of downtown BAR NONE. They have an amazing friendly staff, amazing food and the best margarita cocktails - you can't go wrong.

I would recommend this to anyone who is staying downtown and wants amazing high end mexican food.
author: Chris P.

description: Delicious! I have tried most of the food on the menu and it's all been amazing. My favorites however are the ribs, tacos, and the spicy margarita (I'm not a big drinker but I absolutely love this one).
author: Jessica H.

description:
I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Matador at dinner a couple of weeks ago.

We didn't have a reservation - since they don't accept them, but they were quick to seat us and our server was attentive throughout the evening - despite a packed house.

Matador's drink menu is worth exploring. They have a nice array of fresh and fruity alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks - many of them made with fresh juices. 

We shared some guacamole and a selection tacos.

The carnitas tacos were exceptional and they paired beautifully with the well seasoned guacamole. I was not very impressed with the tuna taco though. I found myself shaking an unhealthy amount of salt upon it  - just to encourage more flavor. 

If you're like me and enjoy eating fish for breakfast  - Matador also serves up a weekend brunch. Their brunch boasts an array of seafood inspired savory dishes, which I imagine pair up beautifully with their brunch drink menu, which features an interesting sweet imbibe called the Matador de Horchata  - concocted with horchata, mezcal, cinnamon syrup, and chocolate mole bitters.

Matador's a fun spot to manifest some light tacos, unique drinks, and a fun low-key atmosphere for a classic San Francisco evening.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: Maybe I didn't order the right thing but this place was pretty meh. Guacamole was just okay, pastor and matador tacos were not good.
author: Lauren B.

description: Awesome spot! Staff was friendly and food was great. We got tacos de Barbacoa,  two thumbs up! I tried the red michelada which was perfect. The jalapeño margarita was a little spicy. We had ordered a Corona as well but it was a little warm. Once we mentioned it to the waitress she switched it for a new one without complains or nasty looks. The restaurant was clean and pretty neat. We would go back.
author: Vanessa R.

description:
We hosted a party here last night. This place is so great that I have to rave about it on yelp. The restaurant is really nice and open, with high ceilings, big windows along the street side and an outdoor sheltered patio and a great bar. There is a beautiful piece of art painted on one wall. There are beautiful very old black and white photos that have been blown up and placed around the seating area. Apparently they are the family members of some of the staff. 

We did all the event coordination via email and the correspondence was very professional. We found all of the food to be delicious. Like really really good. They had proposed a buffet menu for our guests and it was perfect. Four kinds of tacos with very generous portions of meat, including a veg option, crazy good salad with fresh veggies and cojita, corn with crema, yummy beans, etc. Our friends were constantly coming up to me telling me the how delicious everything was. For dessert they put out insanely good coffee and caramel flan as well as churros with chocolate and caramel sauce. 
Yum.

Cocktails were some of the best we've had, in particular the blackberry smash, the Matador old fashioned and the spicy margarita. The bartenders were very cool, polite and helpful with suggesting drinks, the service excellent and Kris the manager was very attentive and took such good care of us. I'm really blown away by the great experience we had and would highly recommend Matador for a private party. They can seat 40 but we had 55 or so guests and the space worked great, not super crowded. We will definitely be back with our friends to have dinner and drinks here. Thanks you guys for making our party flawless!!
author: Lynn R.

description: They probably make great cocktail but the food was lacking the trueness of Mexican touch. I got chips and salsa. The chips was fine but the salsa was really lacking any kick. No salsa verde came with my order. Also ordered spicy shrimp with mango tacos. 3 for $15 is a lot of money for taco. I found the tacos are very small for the money. Shrimp and other ingredient was very tasty but there is no way to hold them together.
author: Jag M.

description: The food is great, but service sucks. The waiter came to our table when we still were having  drinks and asked us to leave because "there are guests waiting". After I started signing the receipt, he asked us to leave for the second time. I didn't leave any tips *obviously*, and later my card was extra charged. Is it some kind of waiter revenge for no tips or something? Never coming to the place again.
author: Artur B.

description:
Mmmmm, it was so good!  

The Queso Fundido was AMAZING!  Hot and gooey cheese topped with perfectly roasted mushroom/poblano/corn combined with chorizo?  YES, SIR.  May I please have another??  Oh, and the Matador Margarita is close to the top of my list of best margaritas.  OK, now I'm hungry (and thirsty) again.
author: Kevin M.

description: Stopped in to this surprising little place for a quick bit to eat after arriving from NY. Started with the salsa tasting and homemade guacamole which were incredibly delicious. Shared the bacon wrapped fish tacos and the spicy shrimp tacos which were both equally tasty and so fresh! Highly recommend for not only the amazing food, but awesome service!
author: Brad P.

description: Loved it. Tasted fresh, great service. The spicy margarita was fantastic. I'd go back for more!
author: Tucker S.

description: Fantastic tapas & Mexican plates. Watermelon Agua Fresca is a MUST. another must, Sopas Ranchero. Comfort food. Funky neighborhood. Very friendly staff, but appeared understaffed, service was a bit slow and had to ask for check a couple of times. Another tip, fantastic bathroom for patrons. Well done. Will be back.
author: Barbie B.

description:
Great food. Service is less to be desired. Actually , the bus boy is better than the wait staff.
They were not that busy. Even later in the evening they were struggling with keeping up with patrons.
author: Rob P.

description: Thanks again Yelp. Great spot for us to grab lunch after some San Francisco retail therapy. Tried 4 different tacos between 2 of us. All good. Complimentary salsa trio and chips with check in were a bonus. Enjoyed my lunch with a local craft ale. Don't think you'll be disappointed if you read reviews and check out menu. It's time to head back to hotel for nap and a little college f'ball before the next meal!!
author: Bill L.

description: Awesome food, cool atmosphere and great service.  The tacos are amazing. The guac is delicious, as well. The owner hung out and talked for a bit about the artwork and the restaurant background.
author: Micah W.

description: Relatively new to SF, staying on Nob Hill. Best Mexican within 20 min walk of Union Square. Enchiladas Rojas are my personal go-to.  Alone so ate at the bar, good vibe.
author: David H.

description:
Used to really like this spot but it's gone downhill... slow service, non attentive staff, and mediocre food. Fish tacos came and I could tell they were uncooked just looking at them. Cold and uncooked. Yuk!! As soon as I set my fork down my man noticed my look of disgust and immediately commented on his food "these tacos sux.. they taste like cat food". 
We sent the food back and they took our plates in surprise. As we finished our drinks and chatted with the table next to us, they got a bit snooty with us... asking us to move to the bar, and move out of way.. distasteful. Went across the street to a lovely Italian restaurant with great service and food. Sadly, won't be coming back.
author: Michele O.

description:
This place wins the award for worst service I've had in San Francisco. The food is interchangeable with any other overpriced taco place in SF. I normally don't rate based on service, but when your server 1) takes 15 minutes to return to take your order, 2) doesn't write down your order and forgets EVERY SINGLE ITEM, 3) continuously brings the WRONG food to your table, 4) argues with you over what you had ordered, 5) bills you incorrectly and stands over the table with the receipt in his hand as he studies it, 6) fails to bring you water refills, 7) tries to clear the table when there is still food and no one waiting to be seated ... well ... the food wasn't memorable but the shit service certainly was.

It was also really annoying how the tables are tiny, this is a place where you are going to order multiple plates, and the servers will bring you food and just stand over you with an air of impatience and wait for US to make room for our food on the too small tables.
author: Melissa T.

description: The sopa ranchera was good, but needed some salt. Chips are fresh and warm. Salsas are quite bland, except for the roasted tomatillo habanero which was great. Margarita was also good, not great. Too much ice. The tacos are small for the price. It's San Francisco though so be prepared to spend more than anywhere else.
author: Candice G.

description:
I went here based on the yelp rating, was extremely disappointed.  I do not understand how it has got 4 stars at all, wondering if these were paid reviews or something.

We came in and got a table for two right away and ordered chips and salsa and a pitcher of margaritas.  Chips and salsa came out but the pitcher didn't show up for another 30 minutes!  Even worse is the pitcher was small and full of ice, complete rip off as it had maybe 3 actual drinks in it.  Finished the margaritas and left without getting dinner since we were pretty annoyed with everything.

I would not visit again, there are much better options for a lot less.
author: Dave G.

description: This place is really good and the price is reasonable. The drinks are a little expensive but the tacos are top notch. Many styles to choose from and the preparation and flavor choices are on point. Thai is a great place for lunch, brunch, or dinner.
author: Robert K.

description: I was staying around the corner and saw this place on Yelp so decided to try it. It was very crowded, but I was solo so fortunately found a spot at the end of the bar. I felt a little forgotten about- it took a long time for the staff to take my order and then they actually forgot my food so I waited a while. if you check in on yelp you get free chips/trio of dips! I also had 2 margaritas and the matador tacos. Prickly pear margarita was too sweet, but different and refreshing. Matador tacos, i'm told, are a signature dish. These were pretty good- asada with a mango slaw. They had a kick so beware if you can't handle heat. I'm glad I tried it but am not sure i'd come back- the food was "good" but not outstanding and worth dealing with the crazy traffic/parking near union sq.
author: Melissa P.

description: They wouldn't seat me at a 2 top because my girlfriend hadn't arrived, even though I was willing to order. They gave my seat away as my girlfriend arrived. Absolutely ridiculous. I will never try to go again.
author: Hector S.

description: Very friendly staff, delicious tacos. Lots of interesting drinks, including margaritas, sangria, and Mexican beers. Cool, trendy vibe but still cozy and not too crowded. Seemed like a fun place for happy hour.
author: Therese F.

description: Decent tacos, but they didn't have much flavor. I salted the meat, and they were much better.
author: Mike S.

description: Awesome customer service!!!  The place  is pretty,  we loved the decor. Our server took really good care of us HE was  great and gave us some recommendations, we end up loving the food as well!!! we ordered Pozole, queso fundido and costillas   everything had  a really good flavor.  We'll definitely come back.
author: Bianca G.

description: The food was really amazing. The service was mostly adequate, but not nearly as on par as the food. The staff was polite but there were a couple of times that we felt forgotten about. Overall we liked it and will possibly come here again.
author: Lauren H.

description: Delicious chips and salsa. The price of of guac ($10) for the amount was crazy! Shrimp tacos were tasty. Atmosphere was quaint.
author: Liz C.

description: This was a really good taco place came here with my friend Brittany and we demolished 6 tacos total. The portions are p big but it's kind of pricey tbh. It's also weirdly upscale for a taco place pro tip don't wear birks and lulus like we did. Also there were people in suits like they had just come here from a shift at Goldman Sachs sooooo dress accordingly
author: Jing W.

description: The shrimp tacos are fantastic and not bad sangrias either. I highly recommend the tacos for sure...I know I will definitely return!
author: Christa A.

description:
Move over mission, these tacos are NO JOKE.  I stayed in Union for a conference and found this place just up the hill from my hotel.  Everything was SOO GOOD.  I went back three times, and in between went to the mission for a burrito.  Sorry mission bros, but this place is on top of it's game.  Back to Matador to get my taco fix before I leave.  

SIX STARS
author: Jason W.

description: I'm only giving this place 4 stars because I really wanted to like their "yellow michelada" with mango purée.. but it didn't make the cut. Tasted really weird. My boyfriend had a regular michie & it wasn't as bad. As a server myself, I tend to find myself being supper critical about service and food portions. Their taco el matador was delicious ! And really well served . The shrimp taco was very bland with only two huge shrimps. My boyfriend ordered enchiladas and it didn't specify it had sour cream drizzled on top (he hates sour cream). So he really wasn't digging them. The guacamole we ordered was a scam for 9.50$. Regardless, the place had an awesome vibe and the servers were great.
author: Lizbeth M.

description:
Stopped in for the 1st time Friday evening with a party of 2 and had a delightful time!

THE SPACE: very nicely decorated, tons of spots to sit, there's even a small lounge area if the rest of the place gets busy.

STAFF: Kate, who fluctuated between hostess and server, was amazing and took really good care of us. Two thumbs up.

FOOD: So, so delicious. We got....

- Chips and Salsa to start ($3) very tasty home made chips and great salsas
- Ribs, a newer item on the menu. The meat was so tender it came right off the bone. Yum.
- Carnitas Tacos ($11) maybe my favorite item that we tried. Mixture of crispy and soft textures, flavors rejoicing in your mouth!
- Pescado Tacos aka Ahi Tuna ($11) very light, fresh, and tasty in flavor
- Churros ($8)

DRINK: Here's my only caveat, the frozen margaritas ($13 for the large) have a ridiculous amount of alcohol in them. Even if you want to get more than 1, you probably shouldn't. With that said, very fun to order :)
author: Rachel R.

description:
Matador is a bit on the pricier side, but the food is good and the drinks are even better.

Definitely get the frozen margarita if you're there to imbibe - it's really strong! You also have the option of adding a coronita or champagne to your drink if you're feeling adventurous.

Our dishes:
- Queso Fundido
- Coctel de Camaron Estilo Veracruz
- Posole Rojo
- Taco de Matador
- Carnitas Tacos
- Barbacoa Tacos
- Guava Flan

I really enjoyed the shrimp cocktail (coctel de camaron), the posole, the barbacoa tacos, and the guava flan. The turkey in the Taco de Matador was a nice change of pace from the typical taco meats, so I recommend giving it a try if you're in the mood for something different.

While it's difficult for me to justify the cost of the tacos, I can definitely see myself coming back here for more drinks. It's a great addition to the area - one I hope to be frequenting more often!
author: Kelly L.

description: $14 for a sub-par Burrito that fell apart as soon as I touched it.. $13 for an incredibly underwhelming margarita that mainly consisted of mixer. Once everything was said and done I paid $62 dollars for a lunch that was worth about $30. Only redeemable thing about this place was the servers/bartenders.
author: John W.

description: Great tacos and margaritas (including frozen)! The atmosphere is trendy and the staff is always friendly and welcoming. My friend and I sat next to a server on her break eating an off-the-menu taco and the chef agreed to make it for us.
author: Rachel C.

description: Besides the fact that they have an incredibly diverse selection of drinks and food, the staff is also incredibly diverse and welcoming. Know that as you walk in you'll be greeted by warm smiles and a stiff drink. Gotta give a shout out to Joleen and Christy who made my night one to remember. Great staff, music, and environment makes Matador a definite "go-to" downtown San Francisco.
author: Milton P.

description:
Came here for dinner and drinks before a comedy show at the Marine memorial. 
My friends were here the year before and thought the place was great. I was not impressed. 
Our drinks took about 20 mins to come out and there were only two other tables occupied. 
I agree with another review that the chips and salsa were the best dish. Chips were fresh and well seasoned and the salsa was flavorful with the right amount of heat. 
My Ranchero soup was bland and was missing something fresh. I wanted to ask for avocado but finding our server was impossible. 
Service needs much improvement. No one checked in on us after we received our food. And I had to walk up to the bar twice to get my one drink. Each time the server made me feel like I was out of place. 
Finally after sitting with all our empty glasses and most of our empty plates on the table we flagged down a server to bring us our check. 
My friends did get a few flights of tequila that they liked but when a flight (3 shots) is $18 and then you order one shot for $14 this doesn't quite seem right. 
So if you just want some chips, salsa, and tequila this is probably your place (provided you have some time to kill). Otherwise meh.
author: Serena L.

description: The spins they add to these traditional tacos is amazing and out of this world. The aguachile is perfect to pair w/ beer. The tacos al pastor with pineapple is a perfect pairing. The tacos bistek rancheros is made with amazing steak and the carnitas are super tender. I will definitely be coming back here.
author: Kevin C.

description: This was a unplanned late dinner me and a friend stumbled upon while walking around. The cute black and white films projected on the upper wall above the tables was so unique. The setting was so relaxing and inviting. It felt cozy! Customer service was amazing. The best carnitas I've ever had!! Hands down. The flavor, and tenderness was amazing. Flavor was delicious. Salsa and chips were great as well. Coming back for sure when we visit the city again.
author: Allee C.

description:
I'd really like this place to improve, mainly because it is near where i work and has corn GF tacos, but so far its been hmmmmmmmm.
Its also fairly new, and might look pretty, but it ends there.

Basically it is just a VERY overpriced taco joint, with a bar, close enough to Union Square (it thinks) to charge what it pleases. A restaurant it may be posing as - but is not.
Sadly, unlike GOOD and authentic Taco joints, this place offers mediocre tasting and presented food; no salsa bar or hot sauce in sight!! no extra napkins and no cilantro (wtf?!!) and a less than rapid service (pleasant but inattentively slow).

My two a la carte (unsizzling shrimp) tacos came with watery salsa, warm-ish, on cold tortillas (probably because they were served on a napkin on a cold steel platter.....PSSST, guys, real restaurants have dishes!. My chips were luke warm, in a cold steel bucket. I had to ask for salsa and was asked which one vs a choice (and charged a buck). The $10 side of guacamole was ice cold from the fridge, and did not have the texture - or flavour - of home made. Granted it was a cold day, but i would have been nice to only experience half of the temperature gradient versus all of it in one meal.

So...if you are looking for a marguerita and already had a couple beers and didnt make it to the Mission that night, go for it.
Otheriwse - um, nope.

2x tacos
1x guacamole
1 person
$25
author: tigipop ..

description: This place is so delicious. The matador margaritas are so delicious and all tacos rock. Love the quest fundido has mushrooms that really make the appetizer so delicious. I love the flavors of the salsa too. YUM!
author: Nadine W.

description: I did take out and had the vegetarian option. It was delicious!! Will definitely be coming back here! Salsas were awesome as well!
author: Mon O.

description: Found this place while attempting to find another place. The exterior drew us in and I'm glad we went with Matador. The drinks, the variety of salsas, the food, the ambiance, the decor, EVERYTHING was perfect. Pablo was attentive and kind and I had to introduce myself after dinner and thank him personally for the great experience. I can't wait to go back for more! Try the Al Pastor tacos and churros for dessert!!
author: Elizabeth E.

description: Service is hit and miss but the tacos Matador are great and so is the Guacamole. They usually don't have enough people on hand to cover the tables when it is busy. Nice employees and good margaritas as well.
author: Mark L.

description:
Food was very good. The ambience was great as well. Small restaurant but well decorated. 
I got the Yellow michelada and the veggies tacos and both were really good.
author: Nitesh D.

description: Tacos are nothing special. 2 measley tacos for $12 not worth it. Only went here cuz their kitchen was open later than some of the other bar/restaurants nearby. Good atmosphere and the bartender was nice though
author: Thomas N.

description: Getting them to bring water to our table was a chore. Had to ask twice before they brought water (in a bottle) for our family of five (3 kids) - their bottle had 3.5 glasses. So, I had to ask them again, got a little attitude, and it took a while to bring another bottle of water. We ordered chicken tacos and the cheese quesadilla and food was decent, not authentic Mexican but decent. However this is not a kid-friendly place and service was mediocre so we won't be coming again!
author: Pranav G.

description:
We were looking for a place to grab dinner and noticed Matador.  We had been to the place it was previously so we were intrigued to see what it was now. 
We sat at the bar ordered tacos and drinks.  My steak tacos were flavorful & tender.  We also order queso fundido which was yummy!  
As we were getting ready to leave, my husband had a medical emergency and the bar staff rushed over to help.   I can't thank them enough for helping us in such a scary moment.  
Thank you Lenny and please thank your friend for us. My husband is fine but it could have been worse had we not had such amazing support. 
We'll definitely be back!
author: Raquel H.

description:
At a glance, this place looks like a fancy bar with its mood lighting and trendy vibes. If I hadn't looked this place up in advance, I wouldn't have guessed it was a Mexican eatery--until I saw the menu, of course. The food here is slightly pricey, but yummy for sure. I absolutely loved their mango frozen margarita and carnitas taco!

The taco portions may be small if you're famished, but get the chips and salsa/guac while you wait :)

This is a great place for a date or for hanging out with a small group of friends.
author: Rie U.

description: Probably one of the worst Mexican restaurants I've ever been to. The carnitas were so salty they were inedible. Barbacoa tasted like dishwater. Pozole wasn't cooked long enough so the spices tasted raw. Definitely not authentic Mexican, would never come here ever again.
author: Bianca S.

description: A little pricey but the food is really good. The guacamole may be the best I've ever had!
author: Liz S.

description: Came here on a Friday night after work. Our server Joleen was very helpful in helping me pick out a mezcal drink. We ordered different types of tacos and chips and queso. It's hard to find queso in the city since we all love our guac, so I was happy to find some here. Joleen also gave us some tips on what to do in the neighborhood while we were there. Good food and good service. We'll be back!!
author: Barie W.

description:
This place was awesome! We met Pablo and he made our night!  Genuine, caring, and very funny person. Our bartender from Turkey was awesome. Great service and the guacamole dip was great. 

If you come ask for Pablo and say Maria and Henry said hi!
author: Henry M.

description: Only picked this restaurant because of its convenience to my hotel but I have to say as a tourist, I will not go here again.  Maybe this is a locals hang out but for tourist, you can find better restaurants in the area to go find a quick bite. Tiny place which your conversation and other tables around you can be heard with no problem.
author: Mario G.

description:
I went Saturday with a large group and had a very great, accommodating experience. We were given a larger table when one opened up and my food was great. 

While my aguachile was a bit small it was fresh and exactly as I prefer it. My husband ordered their enchilada and found it was like a casserole upon arrival . We were both surprised to find it was the absolute best enchilada we'd had in a very long time- highly recommend.
author: Jade H.

description: A New Mexican place opened less than a month ago..good layout, nice staff and clean. Has outdoor seating as well. The drinks menu looks amazing although I did not get to try any as stopped for quick bite. Had the shrimp taco (2 for $11) which was good taste but could be better with avocado added to it. While it is not on the recipe the server told me that you can request to add to the taco and they would happily do it.
author: Bhavika P.

description: Very quick and in expensive. Started with the chips and guac to start, also came with hot sauce, not sure what kind but was delicious, ended up putting it on everything. Also had the steak tacos and chicken tacos, both had great seasonings and were tender. Definitely recommend.
author: Nick O.

description:
Loved the cocktails and tacos, especially the spicy margarita and carnita tacos.
Always a wait time on Sat nights, but the bar is almost always available and they serve food on the bar.
author: Ved P.

description:
The food was ok, nothing special. 

The service was good though! Pablo was awesome! If Pablo serves you, it will definitely be a pleasant experience.
author: Jonathan L.

description: I had their carnitas tacos and they were mouth watering with there homemade tortillas. If you want a good Mezcal Rita in the city, this is the place.
author: Jessica C.

description: Stopped in for a quick bite during Christmas vacation. Cool, casual, and hip decor. Wonderful young lady working the bar who definitely knew how to pour a drink. Quesadillas were solid and had typical California ingredients. Very fresh, very flavorful. Prices were higher than your typical taquerias but this is a different vibe.
author: Heath H.

description:
1) Mezcal with pineapple syrup and lemon- smoky, but not too smoky.  I don't even like smoky drinks, but this one I would definitely order the next time. Well made.
2) prickly pear margarita- tastes like a fruit candy, but still pretty good 
3) ahi tuna with avocado and fried cilantro-on a hard taco shell, very flavorful, the better one of the tacos 
4) Barbacoa with tomatillo salsa-soft taco, slow braised, tender beef

There was no wait because we chose to sit at the bar where they also serve food. The bartenders were friendly and attentive in service even though they were very busy. It's a great place for drinks, but if you're not too hungry. They give you two delicious tacos, but it's not a dinner place and won't fill you up if you haven't eaten at all. It's easily $9-12 per taco dish.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Not only were they amazing but I also learned something about frozen margaritas at matador- in order to freeze the strawberry margarita the sugar content has to be higher. What does this mean in real terms? It means they had to add a lot more tequila. Will definitely be back for brunch when they serve their new concoction of margarita meets mini champagne bottle.
author: Leina K.

description: Decent place to grab sometime quick but would not give it a thumps up for tourist to come try this place out.
author: Mario G.

description: I wouldn't come here again. Ordered chicken quesadilla and the steak tacos. It was edible but I didn't crave having another bite of my meal. Plenty of leftovers to take home and give to my roommates. The service is extremely slow and no refills on our water when we got dessert. Speaking of dessert, the churros were pretty disappointing. Flavorless, really.
author: Ghezal O.

description: This is a really cute place with awesome service and great food... Hey had a good drink menu. I'd recommend having the red sangria and the tacos matador (careful the mango salsa has a kick to it) also the esquite was delicious... they have homemade salsa that was also great... we will definitely be back if we are in town.
author: Jenna G.

description: Look at your receipt. They automatically add a tip, then prompt you to add an additional tip. At the bottom there is an additional 4% surcharge for the batcrazy stuff SF voters passed.
author: Edward O.

description: The tacos we had were good but you couldn't mix and match more than two kinds, sad! The chips and salsa were also solid. Our server didn't really check up on us and we weren't given any more water after having drank our pitcher quickly. Bathrooms were very nice.
author: Mike P.

description: Best tacos and margaritas we had in SF. Amazing service as well! This is an absolute must if you're visiting.
author: Leia T.

description: Really good food and nice atmosphere! We had the salsa and chips as an appetizer which came with three salsas. My husband had the enchiladas and moladas and I had the vegetarian tofu-rizo yummy.
author: Jaylou V.

description: Finally got to try this place. I like the decor of the restaurant upon walk in. Staff were welcoming and friendly. We started with chips and trio of salsa, paired with red and white sangria.Then we ordered barbacoa tacos and quesadilla. The food was delicious. I found my favorite place for Sangria!!!
author: Kath S.

description: Great tacos, but Freebird came on, so 5 more stars for Freebird! But that queso though!!!
author: Otto W.

description: Awesome carnita tacos and chicken quesadillas.  Both had a lot of meat in them. Will definitely come back before I leave town.
author: Trey H.

description: We would have enjoyed our early dinner a lot more if we had not decided to sit at the bar, where we witnessed how drunk the bartender was. He was so shitfaced he could barely stand up.  He filled my margarita glass with so much ice that when he poured the drink it overflowed and washed away all the salt.  A margarita that I had to request three times before he repeated the right one. It was a good recipe so I look forward to coming back and having one as I ordered it. Then we had to repeat both items we were ordering several times before we were convinced he had them correct. We even pointed to them on the menu. I was able to watch over his shoulder as he painstakingly tried to enter the TWO items in the computer and was relieved when he succeeded.  The food is very good. We weren't in a hurry so we stuck out his fumbling.  Can't say the same for the two other separate people who tried to order from him but then gave up and left.  He's got to be a relative because it was apparent that the other guys working there knew he was out of it.  The manager finally had to come over to help him generate our bill.  So dinner and a show I guess. I'd have fired him on the spot.
author: Dar V.

description:
Food was decent, decor was good. However the service was abysmal. 

Got seated right away, but no one came over to take our drink order for over 15 minutes. When the waitress arrived, she stopped first at a table who came in later than us and wasn't ready to order yet. No problem, maybe she didn't see us. Took our order, mixed up our drinks. Again, no problem, we can just switch them ourselves. Food comes very quickly, which is fine cause we're starving. My girlfriend only got one of the tacos she ordered. 

So, again, no problem. Maybe the waitress forgot. We'll ask her when she comes back to check on us. But she never did. We wait and wait. Try to flag her down but she doesn't see us (or ignoring us??). She stops at the tables next to ours but always is facing away. By this point I want another drink and some water since I'm trying to eat a burrito the size of my arm. But nope, no one comes over. The other table finishes, pays, and leaves. The waitress and the host start arguing about table configurations for some customers they want to seat. I give up at this point. Eventually the host comes over and asks if we want anything else. We get the check and then, finally, our waitress comes back over to take our card. 

Look, maybe it was busy for this place, maybe it understaffed, I don't know. If that was the case, just say something. Let us know. I'll understand. But our waitress missed out on us ordering another taco and another margarita. And despite working a short distance away, I'll most likely never return here. Which is a shame because the food was good.
author: Matt K.

description: Jolene was great!  Food was good and cocktails were creative.  They serve food late which is a bonus.  Had four different kinds of tacos and enchiladas at our table.  All were great!
author: Josh S.

description: This is a great little Mexican place. Love the decor! Staff was really nice and my tacos and guac were really really good. Had lots of yummy choices!
author: Kim P.

description: Worth it! Great food, reasonably priced, great people-watching spot. Recommend going off hours as space is tight, popular place. Also, relax on service speed as Pablo, though good, running all over. Ordered salad and tacos, chips/salsa and Guac and basic drinks for $30. Will go repeatedly.
author: Mark M.

description: Carnitas tacos was great. Beer list was crazy pricey for a bottle of Mexican beer at $7.
author: Brian B.

description: We started off with the chips and salsa which were really addicting to eat. A few minutes later they were gone and the waiter came by with a free refill! For the main course my girlfriend and I both got plates, which are loaded with an enchilada, rice, and beans. It was covered with cheese and sour cream, so it was really heavy. I had to take off the cheese in order to finish the actual stuff. The meat inside the enchilada was average too, not too great for the price. Overall it was decent Mexican food but I would rather choose Chipotle over it any day.
author: Aaron G.

description: Really great casual Mexican restaurant! Loved the Costillas con Chipotle Agave! Micheladas are a hit here too! My girlfriend loved her White Sangria and ate all her Enchiladas Rojas!
author: Sergio S.

description: Excellent burritos. Margaritas were overpriced at 13.99 for a small drink. The place was clean and the staff attentive.
author: John B.

description: We found a sweet little spot that was not too busy to take a party of 6 for Taco Tuesday. Pablo was very nice, after we called to see if they could accommodate us, he saved the table for us for 15 minutes!  Margaritas were good, we had the Matador Pitcher and the Tacos were delicious. Try the Carnitas..... super good!
author: Joanne S.

description:
I was really looking forward to trying this place as the menu looked promising. Like many other reviews have noted, the service was terrible. The restaurant was not busy by all means so I don't understand why the service was so slow. The woman sitting next to us ending up leaving before getting her food because it took way too long.

We decided to sit at the bar. Although the bartender acknowledged our presence, he didn't hand us a menu until after he was done loading the dishwasher which was five minutes after we sat down. Seriously?!? It takes less than ten seconds to grab a menu and give it to us. 

Finally after about 15 minutes our food and drinks order was taken. I had the horchata matador and the tacos de matador. Both were ok. The meat in the taco had a lot of fat on it and the tortillas were really greasy. We ordered guacamole as well but never received.

There seemed to be turmoil between the staff too. At one point a man, who might be the owner, had to come in and talk to the bartender and server. I understand that sometimes coworkers don't get along, but don't make it so obvious! 

Not sure if I'd give Matador another chance. Maybe if they improve their service. 

One last thing to note, you can't mix and match tacos during dinner hours. This was annoying as I wanted to try more than one flavor.
author: Marycruz M.

description: To die for fresh Mexican with some amazing tequilas on the shelf! Definitely a stop on future visits!
author: Brian S.

description:
My buddy wanted Mexican food and I didn't want to go to the Mission. Big mistake.

The menu here has tacos in orders of 2 or 3 - but and unlike most Mexican places you can't mix and match. With some groups this is fine but my buddy is vegetarian so we each got to try only one type of taco this meal.

I ended up with the carnitas tacos, which seemed pretty flavorless. I was told the vegetarian tacos weren't much better.

The guac wasn't particularly good relative to others that I've eaten recently. The corn was the best thing we ordered this meal.

At least the service was attentive and the prices for a sit down dinner in a nice environment were relatively cheap.
author: Jeff L.

description: Went there in May 5. Probably one of their busiest days of the year. Overall, food was good and drinks were okay. We had beef tacos and pork tacos. Both were good. Drinks tasted pre batched and weren't great. I asked for no salt on my margarita, but it definitely tasted salty. The sangria had no fruit in it except for a lime. That was weird. Minus one star for drinks and minus another star for the hostess. She was weird and flustered and we were totally confused when we arrived.
author: Jeff W.

description:
Matador is my new favorite taco spot in the city, and best of all, it's in my neighborhood! I've been on the fence for a while about giving this place a review because it always has available seating, which is almost impossible to find at good restaurants in SF. What can I say, when I find a gem, I want it all to myself.

I highly recommend their Carnitas and Al Pastor tacos. Their guacamole is a must and definitely get the salsas--they're different from what you usually get at taquerias. I never had this because I avoid dairy, but my friends all seem to enjoy the Esquite.

As for drinks, my favorite is the Passionfruit Margarita but I've also enjoyed the Honeydew Rum Mule. 

Although the service can be hit or miss (which I attribute to it being a rather new establishment), the staff is always very friendly.
author: Rafaella S.

description: The place was very cute and I was excited to get dinner there. The menu looked amazing as well! I don't see frozen margaritas often so I was excited about that. Everything turned out to be a let down. My friend and I both ordered margaritas and they were almost impossible to drink. They tasted nothing like the flavor they should've been and we had to tell the waitress that we couldn't drink them. We ordered Barbacoa tacos and the meat tasted and smelled like fish? We contemplated for a minute that maybe this was tuna instead of beef?? The taco was so greasy and piled with meat that we couldn't pick up the soaked and soggy tortilla. We had to eat the meat with a fork right out of the taco. I will say that the chips and guacamole were pleasantly delicious but not good enough for me to return. We went close to closing which might be why we had such a poor experience and hope they can make some immediate changes!
author: Ani A.

description: Honestly the tacos were too bland! The only good thing I had was the queso fundido and the flan!
author: Stephanie A.

description:
I was so excited about this place but it was a huge let down! First let me tell you about the positives: 
- The food was decent (Tried the pozole, carne azada tacos)
- The drinks were okay (Tried the horchata margarita and the matador margaritas)

The reason why I am giving this restaurant two stars is because we had pretty bad service.
- The bar was dead yet it took 10 minutes for the Bartender to take our order.
- The bartender forgot our orders.
- Our food took forever to get made.
- There was drama between the servers and the bartender.
- The lady next to me waited 15 minutes to get her order taken! She also ordered food and ended up canceling her order because they took too long.

I would recommend to hire an experienced bartender. This place has potential but they need to improve their service.
author: Marco M.

description:
We wanted Mexican food and drinks. This is one of the higher rated places we found. So glad we came here! Everything was delicious. We ordered the corn and cheese appetizer thing, I don't know what it was or why it was so delicious but it was! The queso fondido app was also really good. We all got different cocktails and everyone was super satisfied.

The service was pretty good! At first we were told there would be a 20 minute wait but then a guy came up and gave us a table right away. This might have screwed up the group after us but we were happy!

The tacos were amazing. I had the shrimp tacos and the shrimp itself was so delicious. I didn't realize my tacos were going to be spicy as hell, though. I immediately had spicy hiccups and had to take everything unidentifiable off of my tacos. Still ate them!

I would definitely say this is on the expensive side and probably hard to get a table for more than 5 without a reservation.
author: Radostina S.

description: Great little mexican restaurant! Our party of 4 was seated promptly though the place was packed... and stayed full throughout our meal with tables not staying empty for more than a few minutes ... The chips came with a trio of salsas - all very good. Everyone had a pair of tacos that were Yuge: really good portions - if you're  hungry order 3 but we all agreed that 2 was just right:  the carnitas was tender, the chicken was piled high with slaw and guac, and the steak was tender with just the right tinge of pink... highly recommend Matador!
author: Dan K.

description: Such a good place. We were at San Francisco just for 2 days and decided to hang out somewhere. This choice was made accidentally but no regrets after visiting it. The stuff was extremely friendly, cozy atmosphere and here I tried the most delicious tacos in my life :) Thanks guys for this wonderful experience!
author: Tanya N.

description:
On a desperate Monday night when my friend and I had to alter our plans unexpectedly and most restaurants we wanted to go to were closed, and we could not do the 2 hour wait at Liholiho, we stumbled upon Matador.  Quickly yelping it we decided to go in.  In a touristy area, this place seemed like it was not the type of place to cater to tourists - so we thought it would be fine.

I rely heavily on Yelp when I travel, especially in SF.  I tend to trust Yelper's in SF the most.  But oof - this was a miss!  I hope it was a Monday night issue, otherwise not sure this place will be around long.  Service was horrible, unengaged, and we never received a 'thank you'.  We were brought the wrong entre and had to send it back and did not receive a 'sorry about that' or an offer for a complementary something while we waited painfully long for the right item.  Food service was slow and when we got each item, it was cold.  The veggie tofu taco sounded promising but was horrid - I make a million % better veggie taco at home!  Boo.

The icing on the cake for my friend was no changing station for her baby in the restroom.  She had to change her baby on the floor!  Ick.  We realize there are not a lot of people with kids in SF, but seriously?  She lives here - help a woman and baby out people!

I do not wish anyone harm or closure, so I hope this experience was just an unfortunate miss on a single night, otherwise this place needs to get their act together or they will never survive in the competitive SF restaurant landscape.
author: D B.

description: Really poor service, very slow. Took over an hour to get food and we weren't even offered a second round of drinks. No one came to the table to apologize and acknowledge us as we waited. Unimpressed.
author: Evan P.

description: Got the salsa trio, which was good.  Tacos were solid, the Barbacoa tacos weren't as good as the Carnitas.  Really nice flavor in the Carnitas tacos, corn tortillas, 2 tacos is good for a light to medium sized meal.
author: Tiffany F.

description: Way too much salt in everything! And there are too many mismatched flavors in their tacos. No one at my table was happy.
author: Tiffany D.

description: We were told the wait was 15 minutes, but ended up being over 45 - the host was curt and unhelpful when we asked about our table. When we were finally seated, the waiter (possible owner) was very nice. The queso fundido had so much salt, one bite made the rest of the meal inedible so I don't know if the tacos were OK. Go for the margaritas, but do not eat here.
author: Nikki W.

description: Food was cold and the Mole was really bland. The staff didn't seem too worried about it. They microwaved our food and gave it back with barely a word and no apology. Didn't see them again the rest of the meal.
author: aller f.

description:
Terrible service, overpriced.

-Was upsold twice on drinks, including the statement "the drinks are on the other side of the menu"
-They ran out of ahi tuna, so paid for $6 cod tacos
-They brought the wrong soup and the owner was indignant when we corrected him
-Took over an hour to get our food
-Overstated the bill price
author: Mark V.

description:
I want to ignore the fact that the restaurant has a Spanish name but serves a mixture of Mexican and Tex-Mex food in an atmosphere whose decor reflects both Spain and Mexico, but I'm petty and had to mention it. It's a good thing the food is bomb.com to cover up that identity discrepancy. 

I strolled in with four of my best girlfriends during peak hour, 6:30pm on Cinco De Mayo of all godforsaken times to visit a place that doesn't take reservations. But like one of those surreal sequences in a movie where everything goes well for the protagonist, a table was just waiting there for us, glimmering of hope and loud laughter and amazing food and Instagram selfie opportunities. Nice! We snatched it up and proceeded to start our drinking. 

Among the 5 of us we enjoyed:
-White Sangria
-Red Sangria
-Margaritas (rocks not frozen)
-Something frothy and pink that resembled a Will Cotton painting and tasted like a rosebud (but in a good way) 

...and the food portion, oh my:
-Fish Tacos
-Carnitas Tacos
-Carne Asada Tacos
-Guacamole
-Queso Fundido

It's mentionable that when they brought the Queso, which can best be described as a kitchen sink approach to dip, and also a casserole, and also maybe a cheese party, at least two nearby tables craned their necks under the seductive aroma and sizzle of a bubbling melted dish and asked us "what is THAT?" (You're welcome Matador, I just upsold your other patrons). 

Suffice to say my girlfriends and I turned into monsters and didn't come up for air until we ate as much as possible. Also fair to say our selfies didn't turn out so cute, as it sometimes goes when you've just consumed like five hedonists competing for the most severe "before" transformation pic. 

Which, turns out, is exactly what you want in an excellent taco place in Union Square- drinks and food so good, your post-dining selfies look like a disaster.

Predictions: This place will polish up their preparedness for massive crowds, and kill it. The Queso, heaping, unique street-style tacos and gorgeous drinks will be their signature items, and they'll change their name to a more appropriate "Matadorito".
author: Ashley T.

description:
To be fair the one star review is mainly about the service. I would give the food 4 stars and the value 2 stars. 

The service here was terrible! To also be fair, I'm talking about our server in particular, the rest of the staff seemed to be great. Our server (who seemed like the manager) was a Spanish middle aged man with slicked hair with a button down who was also in the front by the host station. First off, when we got there, it was empty but he still took 20 min to take our order. He wasn't the friendliest person and when I ordered the large marg with the extra floater option (yes, it was a bit of a ridiculous drink) he scoffed. He never came to check up on us and 3 times he asked us to move our stuff (it's a tiny place and he had us all cramped together and all we had was our work backpacks!! There was no place to put them!! First to the left of us, now to the right, now put it on our lap! He also did it so rudely.) 

We were so close to the other table, that I could hear them complain about the terrible service too! He treated large parties well but just ignored couples!!! The table next to us even said "is the server terrible to you too??" The answer was yes! Honestly put a damper to the evening, but the food was pretty ok (although overpriced). My main reason for coming here was for the cocktails which I have to say were very good (props to the BARTENDER).
author: Foodeater F.

description: Came here for the first time and had the most amazing tacos ever. Also tried all 3 michelada flavors. Amazing customer service. The chef even came over to talk with us about how amazing his cooking was. I'm from LA, but I'll definitely be coming back here every time I'm visiting SF.
author: Rebecca V.

description: Wow. I live a few blocks away and decided to finally try this spot. I sat down and ordered a margarita and some enchiladas. The margarita came. Not great. After about 10 min passed I was getting impatient. Then the bartender came over and told me that kitchen lost my ticket! There were like 5 people in the whole place and they all had food already!! I said I don't want it forget it. I will never go back here. What a shame.
author: Katelin N.

description: I read in the 2017 SF Michelin book that this place had good tacos, so I thought I would give it a try. Ordered the barbacoa tacos and thought it was okay. It lacked flavor and wasn't as tender as I would have expected. Cute place, but the food was nothing to rave about.
author: Suzanna Y.

description: Yummy chips and salsa trio. Tasty sangria. Chicken quesadilla was excellent. Shrimp diablo tacos were nice and spicy but could have been cooked a little longer. Overall YUMMY!!!
author: Demetria C.

description: Located just outside of Union Square. Modern vibe, awesome bartender, and some of the most unique/greatest enchilada sauce I ever had (red). Bonus* Charlie Chaplin is the manager.. Lot's of mustaches in this spot.
author: John B.

description: Matador is quite a nice step up from Sugar Cafe, which occupied much of the space before. I've enjoyed their tacos more than once now. Just watch out for their margaritas during the afternoon unless you're ready for some day drinking -- they're strong!
author: David S.

description: Overpriced plates, delicious margaritas, and beautiful decor. Giving it 4 stars because although the food is too expensive for what it is, Matador is the perfect place to grab after-office drinks. The house margarita and Mezcal are not to be missed.
author: Rachael B.

description: Came by for late lunch, decent prices and great drinks. I tried both the white and red sangria, both packed a punch, especially the red which they make with tequila. My shrimp quesadilla was huge, more than I could finish. Our server, Jolene, was friendly and personable. Great little place to catch up with a friend.
author: Rebecca H.

description: Food was okay, service was bad. This place is tiny, yet somehow they only came to our table one time the hour or so we were there, and that was to take our order. We even had to go find someone to get our check because no one seemed to care about our table. Most likely because we fit their automatic gratuity of 20% with 6 people, so why take the time to service us I guess.
author: Taylor M.

description: The pork empanadas are the STAR here!  Dipped in a a very yummy tomato sauce!   Very flavorful!  I had the beef tacos as well which were very good.  The chicken tamale was so so. I am a bigger fan of tamales wrapped in corn husks.  These are in plantain leaves and that flavor permeates the tamale.  Rice is a plain white rice probably cooked in a chicken stock. Service was delivered by a very nice young woman and food was delivered quickly.
author: Jackson F.

description:
Stopped in for a quick dinner before a show. My date and I shared the Tacos Matador and fried chicken tacos since you can't mix and match for dinner. Neither were anything to write home about. The beef in the Matador was pure fat, if you love fatty meat then that's your jam but I ate around it. The chicken was really dry and too much (yes, I said too much) chicken piled on to get a single bite of all the full taco experience. Most of the chicken had to be eaten separately. 

They do have Negro on tap and the service was decent as are the prices.
author: Amanda W.

description: Food is great here! Visiting SF and we stop here for dinner. Try Matador Tacos "Delicious" and the soup was very good also
author: Sam P.

description:
Great food and great service. Price for food was good. Margarita $10 on the higher side. No Happy Hour specials that I saw. 
Great little spot, cute inside. 
Servers were very attentive. 
Chicken Tacos were delicious, slightly fried. 
Guacamole was good, didn't seem like it was made in house but still good. 
Margarita was good (kinda small for $10)
I would come back and bring friends.
author: Dee A.

description: We just hosted a 25 person event at Matador tonight at the end of a long conference day. Pablo and his team were AMAZING. The food was terrific-- fresh and creative. All the staff were thoughtful and helpful. Pablo was super attentive. Their bartender was incredibly sweet with one of the participant's kids who showed up even though it wasn't a kid-designed event. What a fabulous experience! Can't say more positive things. Many thanks, Matador, for making our event so special.
author: Laura G.

description:
Finally; proper tacos served downtown!

I came here with a large group of friends, and ate through most of the menu. Really, really tasty tacos; you can't go wrong here. 

Same goes for the margaritas and cocktails; they are exceptional. Try the El Chavo.

Very friendly and fun staff too. I will be back regularly.
author: Beau M.

description: Great environment!!! Small but quaint and very pleasant staff. The sangria is really good and the burritos are huge!!!
author: Adam M.

description: Pretty basic food, really nothing special but the service and staff were great and has a cool intimate atmosphere. Worth a shot if you're hungry and in the area
author: Salvatore S.

description: BEST MICHELADAS EVER!!! I saw the menu at the hotel i was staying at (a few blocks down) being from Texas the tacos and Michelada are what def pulled me in. I came in and was surprised on how hip and modern the place was. Looked and felt clean, was immediately greeted. Sat at the bar and was attended quickly. Ordered the tacos Filet -were amazing- its now day 2 in San Fransisco and i'm back again. Trying something else on the menu but i'm sure I won't be disappointed.
author: Enrique S.

description: Love this new place ! Opened just 6 months , will bring my girlfriends here for sure !! Lenny is so nice and made us great tasty drinks with fresh fruits and tequila Hahahaha
author: Heather Y.

description:
Stopped by because it was nearby and promised an easy quick meal.

I was overwhelmed by flavors, freshness
& quality.  I had the tacos matador
(Brisket). They were wonderful.
Having been to Mexico many times,
I was really blown away. 

My wife had the fried fish tacos.
They were very well executed as well

We will definitely be back
author: Stephen K.

description:
The good:
Cool atmosphere, nice aesthetic, and airy dining area for hot days. 

The bad: 
It's really overpriced - small portions of everything from tacos to drinks. 
The service is slow - it may just be because they're new but they've got kinks to work out. 

Overall - if you like Mexican fusion, a cool environment and don't want to pay through the nose for some beef and tequila, I'd recommend La Urbana on Divisadero.
author: Zachary S.

description: Very nice upscale Mexican place, tasty fresh food and fun cocktails, recommend the Sopa and the Corn, and in a location near Masonic Center without a lot of good options. Muy bueno!
author: Peter H.

description: I happen to be staying in the area and found this place. I ordered the guacamole and chips and shrimp tacos which were absolutely amazing. I had to keep from eating them so fast. After eating my meal I realized the churros were missing. Even though they do not deliver I was staying only 5 min away and they went out there way to deliver my churros. Which were tasty as well. The women who greeted me new I was coming for a delivery when I walked in and was so sweet and when I called everyone was nice. Great customer services to go with the amazing tacos I had. I'll be coming here again when in town.
author: Alexandra F.

description:
Check in for a free chip and salsa finger food.  

They opened the windows today as it was a little warm inside, and it opened up the place nicely.  

Came with a group and we stayed in a tight corner besides the bar.  A bit TOO tight unfortunately.  It made it tough to share food and slip by someone to go to the 2 unisex restrooms (clean, wide, and they use air dryers).

Happy hour drinks (non margarita mixed drinks) are reasonable for a bright newish place.
author: Drew B.

description: I love the veggie tacos and carnitas. The food is great. The drinks are great. I would like them to pay a little closer attention to when they swipe credit cards. A few weeks ago I was charged twice for the same meal. After calling to get the second charge removed they assured me they would take care of it. I then had to call back a second time to get the charge removed.
author: Nnena U.

description: I often stop by (dined here over 5 times) because the environment is enjoyable. Though the food is over priced, it's pretty yummy. The workers / waiters aren't very friendly, they never seem like they want to be there. Only thing they need to work on is customer service.
author: Nikki R.

description: Welcome to the neighborhood, Matador!  My carnitas taco was perfect for dinner one evening with my friend.  It was flavorful and filling.  We also had a couple of pineapple non-alcoholic beverages, which was tasty and complimented our meals nicely, but next time, I will definitely try one of their cocktails as we were sitting at the bar and watched them prepare them - they looked yum!  We also had their churros - hot, fresh and steamy with a bit of hot chocolate on the side (I think it was to drink but I was dipping the churro in it).  Yummy!  I will definitely be back to try more on the menu and those cocktails!
author: Maile N.

description: We had a wonderful experience here. The service was on point & recommendations were perfection! My wife & I were on vacation in San Francisco for our 1 year wedding anniversary & were treated like royalty here. The ribs were recommended by our server & were extremely delicious. Literally fell off the bone! The food was insane & the service was even better. Great place to eat some clean Mexican food in SF! Price point was great too!
author: Stephanie A.

description: Great little Mexican restaurant. Nothing that blew my mind but fast and friendly service and pretty good food. I got the ribs appetizer (yummy!) and it was a big enough portion to fill me up for dinner.
author: Natasha J.

description: Really enjoyed lunch there on a Tuesday afternoon. Expected to wait but was seated immediately. Nice range of drinks but I had a "classic" margarita and my spouse had the white wine sangria which she was pleased with. Tacos were very good. Service was great. Definitely on our list of places to eat at when we get over to the city from Berkeley.
author: John H.

description: Great service. Delicious tacos! Nice quick lunch experience. Would rent the space out if possible for a fiesta!!
author: Aaron L.

description: We loved it!  Delicious melty queso fundido, esquite (corn off the cob with cheese and sour cream, my favorite, and hard to find on a menu!), great chips and salsa, amazing margaritas (try the fuschia-colored prickly pear).  My husband gushed about the Tacos de Matador (brisket with sticky mango salsa, apple and onion slaw).  The restaurant is also very cute inside.  We will definitely be back!
author: Samantha G.

description: Cute place in the loin. Tacos were good (tried the al pastor)! Soup was lacking flavor but was good for a rainy day.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Superb! We had a large, last minute catering order on Cinco de Mayo. These guys were crazy enough to take it and the owners even delivered it.

Taco variety and different salsas were delicious - our group loved it.

Thank You Matador!

This place is great!
Food is elevated and drinks are stellar.
Staff is always friendly and efficient. Nice environment that is welcoming and comfortable.
author: Michael R.

description:
I ate at this place last night and at first I thought it was going to be a bit underwhelming. Fortunately, our waitress was delightful and the tacos were INCREDIBLE. This is a must try place! 

CON: It was SUPER loud and not a lot of space.
author: Jay H.

description: My husband and I love their carnitas and tacos de matador! They are flavorful and have generous portion of meet. Their service is very good too! I appreciated when one of the server patiently answered and cared about my gluten and dairy free diet. We are very lucky to live close to this restaurant!
author: Tomoco I.

description: Super yummy dinner at a decent price in the city. Very cute place and great service. The Posole was different than what we're used to, tomato type base, but good in its own way. Other than that no complaints. We would highly recommend checking it out.
author: Melanie J.

description: This place was alright. I was really expecting stronger flavor from the tacos but they weren't amazing. The tacos I got (the Pollo Milanesa tacos) had habanero in them--and so I expected some spiciness--but they were a bit bland. Also, don't get seated outside! My friends and I were on the second table outside and we were pretty much ignored for entire 1-2 hrs that we were there.
author: Nancy B.

description: At first when my friend and I walked into the place, we thought it was a bit expensive to pay $12 for 2 tacos. Still, we ended up ordering them and OMG they were literally the best I've ever had! I ordered the shrimp and my friend got the beef one. It was amazing. The tacos were melting in my mouth. Also, the bar area was really cute and they have great tequilas! I would suggest this to everyone!
author: Anahit J.

description: It was a quaint spot atmosphere was nice but small not good for big parties. I had the shrimp tostadas and the chicken Soup .. tostadas were very spicy I enjoyed that. Soup was a hit bland .. chips and guacamole wee tasty.
author: Nora D.

description: Matador is the best! The food, drinks and desserts are beyond amazing. The portions at first seem small, but are the perfect size to leave you full without feeling gross. The prickly Margarita is a must Have and any of their dessert selections.
author: Lily L.

description:
I'm so happy to have Matador just a few minutes from our place. My friend and I ate here on the second night of their opening. We were greeted promptly and the waitress was so friendly! We had the guacamole, salsa, veggie tacos and chicken tacos. Everything was delicious and the flavors were bold.
