My boyfriend and I are dining there this week and I cannot wait to try the carnitas tacos! OH and for that amount of food, two people, it came to $36. You can't beat that.
author: Sara J.

description: I feel the need to speak up for this restaurant- I don't write reviews that often but the negatives on this place are so unjustified, I just have to speak up. It's a small Mexican restaurant with delicious food. Most of the waiters are not native English speakers but were completely attentive. We had two meals and three drinks for $65 without tip. Good luck finding that easily in SF. And the vibe is bright and fun- with movies playing on the wall, a purple backlit bar and fun pictures of people throughout. And most important my sangria and enchiladas verde were flavorful and delicious. We will be back.
author: Audrey M.

description: no carne asadatacos, ugly attitudes,rude bartenders, what more can i say? the food stinks and is catered to trash. avoid at all costs. this tourist trap was definitely a place to avoid the moment i read that terrible menu. if you want real food try the mission district and avoid this place. also, craig l. does the l stand for loser?
author: Noe M.

description: This is the best Mexican joint we have been to (and we are from Melbourne and it is up there with some of our favourites there)! The service was amazing. One of the drinks we ordered I didn't love that much and the waiter took it off the bill for us because it was a recommendation which was not expected at all- so so lovely and generous. If we ever come back to SF we will be back here for sure. Amazing tacos and drinks 10/10
author: Aimee J.

description: Walked by this place as a tourist and noticed it was packed, which seemed like a good sign. Had guac and chips and the salad with corn, avocado, corn, tomato, pepitas, and oregano dressing. I think the guac may be pre-made/store bought but it was okay. The chips were warmed, which was a nice touch. The salad was great - could have used a little more corn and heirloom tomatoes, but was tasty and large portion size.
author: Rrose S.

description: Very nice ambience, interesting cocktails, and the tacos were pretty good for a small restaurant. We started with guacamole, chips and three salsas (the smooth red was the best). The queso fundido was a HIT, spicy chorizo with peppers and melted cheese, yumm! We also ordered the corn appetizer which is like an elote-on-a-stick minus the stick, decent. Shrimp tacos borrachos had really generously sized shrimp, two is enough, especially if you order appetizers. The prickly pear (Tunas, not the fish, but the cactus) Margarita was good, but the hibiscus (jamaica) Margarita was better. Service was decent until our server had trouble splitting our check, which we asked up front if that was a problem since we were on business and all needed separate itemized receipts.
author: Lenore M.

description:
So. Good. I'm still sitting here as posting. Ok, so why not 5 stars? Small drinks with too much ice and less than the best dessert. Dining solo tonight I've tried:

Trio of salsa - green, mango and red. Hard to say which is the best . The house made chips definitely win though.

Camarones a la Diabla tacos - Spicydeliciousspiciness. Spicy, meaty shrimp, on amazing corn tortillas. And I don't like corn tortillas. 

Prickly pear Margarita-  can you say yum? The salt rum was especially decadent. But at $11 it was half ice in a 5 or 6 ounce glass.

Pina de mezcal - Also very good. The roasted pineapple was sublime. Remind me to roast pineapple. Again a huge ice block in a small glass and a little bit lackluster on the mezcal itself.

Cremitas-  dessert was the worst part of the meal. Delicious ice creams, with a delicious pepita brittle, in very dry chewy profiteroles. I likely would go flan next time.

I should add that service at the bar was friendly and crazy quick!
author: R. A.

description:
From the moment I walked passed the large window of Matador, I knew I wanted to try it out. My friends and I went this evening and I have to say I was a little disappointed. I had high expectations based on the appearance of the place, but I understand they've just opened. They could be working out a few kinks. 

I ordered the Barbacoa Tacos. The meat was a little bland in my opinion. If I'm paying for 2 nice tacos, I want a nice flavored bite. I found myself adding salt to the tacos. My friend ordered the Pollo Al Jardin Tacos and said they were alright. Nothing spectacular. We also ordered their beans and rice. After the first bite we all shrugged saying, "it's beans and rice". And it was. I don't want to seem so picky about my food, really. I think it's just the expectations that come with a little higher of a price tag. 

I think this will be a solid place in a few more months. I'll give it some time before my next visit! For now, it's alright =)
author: Sarah B.

description: A great spot in what is often a culinary wasteland. I dropped in for a quick lunch thoroughly enjoyed my shrimp tacos and pineapple press. The perfect not too heavy lunch. Bonus: dog friendly! I would love to come with a group so that I could sample more yummy tacos.
author: Melanie W.

description:
I went here for dinner on a friday night and the food, drinks and service was all great. Great chips and guac, good variety of tacos and excellent cocktails.

I went back for brunch on a sunday and it was a completely different experience.  It took over an hour to get our food and it showed up cold so it had obviously been sitting in the kitchen for a while.  It even took 30+ minutes to get our drinks (one margarita, agua frescas and water) and chips.  

We had to keep asking our server to go check to see if our food was ready as other tables that were seated after us were getting better, quicker service.  It was not good and I don't plan to go back.
author: Rebecca N.

description:
Stop what you are doing and come and enjoy!!  Totally legit!!  
Tacos, breakfast, micheladas . . . ya, you get it . . .
author: B M.

description: Stumbled upon this place during a night out. The service was wonderful - very friendly and quick - and the food & drinks delicious. I tried the hibiscus margarita and was very pleased with the fresh not-too-sweet combination of tequila and hibiscus. The portion of guacamole is large (we couldn't finish it!) and fresh. I had two prawn tacos with mango that were spicy and perfect. Will definitely be coming back.
author: Rosa E.

description: The hostess was courteous and socially engaged.  The tequila selection is excellent and the drinks agree made with care and flare.  I recommend this place to anyone visiting our locally looking for a good experience.
author: JOHN F.

description: Great service and Amazing food! Highly recommend if you are ever in the San Francisco area!
author: Lisa W.

description: I liked the design and atmosphere , but the food was just fine! I ordered a shrimp taco. The portion was small and very simple.
author: Hossein J.

description: We went here last week for dinner. The interior is decorated really cool. The food was ok, the service was SLOW, the guacamole was good but it was like $10 for 8oz. I will not be back. Mamacitas and Mezcalito is my jam forever.
author: Robin F.

description: This place is so yummy!  Pazole, quesadillas, tacos and all.   Great service and love the drinks.  A must in SF.
author: Rob C.

description: Ordered matador with UberEATS. Good was amazing, I tried shrimp and tortillas. Hot sauce and food overall is tasty. Good presentation and nice packing. Can't wait to order or eat at their restaurant.
author: Mr C.

description:
This place rocks! Kris is the best! Food is amazing. Going broke eating here.

All the dishes have been better average in their unique flavors and freshness.

Drinks are equally amazing. 

I can't get enough.
author: Karma Is Coming 4 U.

description:
When a restaurateur uses his establishment to make a political statement, it ruins the customer experience for me. Especially when the way it's done is a deceptive surcharge that only showed up at the end on my bill. 

We ate there, but they were unprepared for a family with a small child - no child seat and full price sides were the only option on offer for him.  The food presentation was nice, but ho hum on taste - I had steak enchiladas and my wife the fish tacos pastor.   The waiter was clearly not excited about his job.  When we got the bill, we were hit with a 4% 'employee benefit' surcharge that we didn't expect, and only later saw that it was in unreadable 2 point type among other unreadable text in a bottom corner of the menu. 

All this meant I left the restaurant feeling miserable and deceived, not what I'm expecting for an $80 check.

I feel for the restaurateur who, along with all of his competitors, incurs additional costs mandated by the city.  But reminding his customers of his political views with a penalty on them, in a poorly disclosed manner or not, is not good business.
author: Dan K.

description:
Food was fantastic
Service was great
Ambience was new, modern and casual
Music was popping!
author: Aimée B.

description: Great food and Negro Modelo on tap!  I've had most of the tacos on the menu. Service was also outstanding.
author: Paul L.

description: Fabulous Food & Drinks! Best Barbacoa tacos in the City! (Ask the bartender for the hot salsa If you like spicy ) The cozy, casual ambiance makes it a great place to meet a friend for drinks and snacks! Portions on the smaller side, but very filling and high quality, fresh ingredients. Great service! Lenny makes the best Matador Margaritas, (I always ask for their chili salt rim ) YUM! Make sure to end your meal with their Guava Flan! Very interesting flavor and texture, not too sweet, nice palate cleanser!
author: Jessica A.

description: Stayed opened to serve us a great meal. Their beef taco, the matador taco was o m g amazing. Juicy, tender, flavourful. To die for.
author: Winston L.

description: The food was good, fresh, and a nice take on Mexican. I loved the guacamole! I was worried that it would be too hot given the Serrano pepper, but they were so nice they brought me a little sample so I could try it and it was great. The chicken quesadilla was tasty and my husband enjoyed his enchilada as well. The place is clean, the ambiance is nice and the people are kind. I would have zero problems coming back here.
author: Michelle S.

description:
I was so excited to go to this place! I bookmarked it ahead of time, and drooled at all of their pictures. We had a reservation here for a friend and we were rudely greeted saying that they "simply do not take reservations." 

The bartender was horrible, on top of their staff. Customer service is not a priority to them it seems, as we all felt like we were doing them a favor by being there.

The food is phenomenal, and so are the drinks. Overall, I can't even give them 3 stars because of how horrible their service is.
author: Lana V.

description: Was staying at a nearby hotel and looking for a place to eat. Tried the spicy shrimp tacos, fish tacos, and steak tacos. All were delicious! Flavorful and juicy. Chips and salsa were good too. Good ambiance. Would highly recommend it!
author: Katherine T.

description: Small, quaint, upscale taco bar with amazing tacos and interesting delicious drinks. Carnitas were huge for street style tacos. They come in 2 to an order which is plenty. This place is a must!
author: Jay H.

description: Went here for a girls night. The margaritas are delicious, but a bit pricey. Outdoor seating was nice. The problem was the food and the service. Neither were very good. We all got tacos, which no one really enjoyed, the queso was mostly meat with some shredded cheese on top. The spicy margaritas were top notch, but so expensive. Probably won't come here again, but happy I tried it.
author: Becky J.

description: Came for an early dinner. Our waitress was flighty, seemed more interested with chatting with others at the bar. The tables are very small. Served warm water from a fancy glass bottle, had to ask for ice. We started with drinks, ordered the prickly pear margarita which was not good. Tasted like some cheap drink mix. Next was the guacamole which was equally disappointing and tasted like it came straight out a plastic tub from the grocery store refrigerator section. For $9.50 we expected a lot more. We ordered an assortment of tacos all of which were tasty; I enjoyed the rock cod al pastor and my husband liked the carnitas. If it wasn't for the bad drinks and horrible guacamole we probably would have enjoyed our dinner.
author: Erin K.

description:
Had dinner here the other night because we were in the neighborhood and were interested to see what popped up in the former Sugar Cafe location. Resto was busy when we arrived Tuesday around 8pm, but they were still able to accommodate our party of two. Tables are a little crowded, and the ambience was a little offputting (not a fan of the weird purple lighting they have behind the bar).

Prices are very reasonable, $10-12 for 2 tacos. Tacos were okay, but not excellent. Good amount of filling and sauce in them, but would have preferred smaller pieces of meat vs the large chunks that they had. Drinks were okay too, tasty and a decent amount of alcohol in them.

Overall not a bad place for Mexican if you're in the neighborhood, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again.
author: Anna B.

description: Drinks are stiff and service with a smile! Atmosphere is lively, and comfortable. We stumbled upon this place and decided to go in for tacos. We had the brisket, carne asada and breaded chicken tacos. The chicken were the best. They had a sweet corn w quest that was delish!!!
author: Tamara K.

description:
Awesome new Mexican with delicious in the neighborhood.

The margaritas are fantastic. I recommend the prickly pear, it's served with fresh mint and is not too sweet at all. I also sampled the classic margarita which was solid and the strawberry frozen margarita which was fresh and delicious (word of warning: it's HUGE). 

The guac and salsa selection were great, I wish they had been a bit bigger because they were so tasty. I didn't love my pescado tacos but the pollo tacos were very flavorful.  I expect the food will get even better considering we were there during the soft opening. Portions are small but overall our meal didn't end up being too pricey. 

Great service and I loved the upscale casual interior. Overall, I'm really excited to have this place within walking distance of my apartment. I will definitely be back often!
author: Ana D.

description:
Went here for lunch today. They took the old Sugar spot and remade it into a stylish, airy restaurant/bar. Really good and fresh light Mexican food. Portion sizes are just right for the reasonable prices. Excellent vegetarian tacos. The housemade hot sauce was brilliant. Nice service, highly recommend the Queso Fundido and the Queso tacos as well. Best Oaxacan style cheese I've had in a long while. Nothing greasy, fresh and delicious garnishes, unique ingredients. I was disappointed that the churros and Mexican hot chocolate was off the menu (memories of El Moro), but I would bet the flan is every bit as good as the tacos.  

The menu is simple and very well thought out (also beautiful graphic design). Drink menu also well done. I love a place where the menu is one page(drinks on the back) and not at all fussy.  Everything here gives the impression that Matador is a real labor of love for someone.

I am really happy Matador is 2 minutes from my front door! Go here before hitting the night scene in the Gentri-loin!
author: stephan k.

description: Cool place, nice decor, beautiful art. Everyone  is very friendly.very good Mexican food  reasonable priced. Recommending to my friends to visit.
author: Tatiana T.

description:
Prickly pear margaritas!!!!!

Also yummy albondigas!

Attentive service.  I LOVE what they've done with the space.  Beautiful historic photos all over the place, movies projected onto the walls.
author: Renee B.

description:
We popped in here after a play while in the city for a quick get away weekend.
This place was so good!
The salsa trio has a great mix of salsa as my favorite was the smoked salsa if I could buy it and bring it home I would!
We had the tacos I got the matador tacos and my husband got the shrimp tacos and we shared. They were fabulous with deep flavors. We also had some very tasty cocktails! 
Overall this was a great pop in choice and we would go back in a future visit.
author: Melissa K.

description: Pablo was the best ever!!!! Amazing service amazing food!! If you're looking for Mexican in SF this is your spot
author: Claire F.

description: Enjoyed a late lunch at Matador today. Had the madator margarita which was delicious and my friend had the  hybiscus Margarita which she enjoyed very much.   We proceeded with the corn dish and beet salad.    The beet salad was very tasty.  The corn was just ok. We also enjoyed tacos - matador, carnitas , fish and pork.  All very delicious with just the right amount of heat.  We ended with the Churos which came with caramel and chocolate sauce.  Another great tasty treat    They also outdoor seating but didn't realize it until much later.  Its a small place so I imagine it can get crowded.
author: deanna g.

description: The decor is very cool and the music was fantastic as they played The Smiths which I enjoy very much. We had the carnitas tacos and they are delicious. I've not had a carnitas taco this great in a while.  The classic movie playing up front was a nice touch and the staff was great.
author: Oscar T.

description: Clean look and modern restaurant. Love the old pictures hanging on the wall. Started with a casa margarita. It's fresh and I was surprised they used partida a good quality tequila in their house margarita. Had the birria special, braised goat in a broth with tortillas. It was well prepared and seasoned. The bartender informed me they ran different special on the weekends. Can't wait to comeback and try more of the food. Overall a great experience.
author: Juan M.

description: I came to SF from New York to visit a friend and we decided to go there on our first day to celebrate. The food was yum, so we're the margaritas, but our waiter ruined it all when he asked us to leave multiple times while we were still having drinks because there were people waiting. We even asked him if he thinks it's ok to do so and he said yes and never apologized. Don't bring your guests there unless you want them to remember SF like that :/
author: Aleksandra F.

description: Salsa was top notch! Highly recommend the spicy shrimp tacos. Service was outstanding! Bartender gave us a free tequila shot for being her last customers of the night. Will definitely come back again!
author: Thomas S.

description:
Struggled a bit to write this because the food was great but the service was meh. It wasn't very full when we got there and had to: ask for the chips and guacamole twice that came with checking in on Yelp, asked for water multiple times, and was never checked on, had to flag down. 

Food: on point. The salsa is some of the best I've had. The chipolte had an awesome smoke flavor to it.  The spicy shrimp tacos were amazing. Great depth in the flavors and the added mango played well with the spice. 

Could use a high chair or booster for kids but I'd still come back.
author: Dustin M.

description: Great food, the device is fantastic - we went on a Friday evening and got top care from our waitress and excellent recommendations. The atmosphere is lively and the decor very tasteful. The place is small but totally worth it
author: Sonia E.

description:
We went to Matador last night and had a fantastic dining experience! 

Our order was pretty simple, but everything we had was delicious and inventive. 

Chips & Guac: Classic but a must. Matador's guacamole is just how I like it

Brisket Tacos: WOW! Tender, flavorful, and surprisingly lean. This was a special for the night

Queso: Like no queso I have ever had before! There were mushrooms and some sort of meat, and it was served with tortillas. Definitely indulgent but worth the extra trip to the gym

Oh and the cocktails...Mezacal is the way to my heart so this was an easy win

Staff was nice, food came out quickly, and we left happy and buzzed
author: Miles D.

description:
TL;DR - The food was terrible. The service was poor. And the prices outrageous.

We came in because the menu posted outside looked decent. When we sat down, we got a different menu and were told that the menu posted outside is old and the kitchen no longer makes those entrees. However, the server made an exception and let us order a burrito and a cheese enchilada. The burrito ended up being 95% rice and was BEYOND BLAND, even when doused with salsa. Oh and the bottom side of my burrito was burnt so badly it was completely black. The cheese enchiladas were tiny, and filled with UNMELTED cheese... and yet they cost $18. It barely enough food to feed a baby.
author: Madoolsy W.

description: I've had both dinner and brunch at this cool little spot. Never mind the tasteful and fun decor (huge mural and vintage photos)- I was genuinely blown away by the food. I loved LOVED the French toast! The chips and salsa were excellent as was the salad and taco dish my friend ordered. I never Yelp anything but this place deserves my effort. My new favorite Mexican place for sure.
author: Laura D.

description: Surprised this place has such good reviews. Food was mediocre at best, service wasn't much better.
author: Kristen M.

description: Hands down the best queso fundido I've ever had! They also have very yummy chips which I feel are important in a Mexican restaurant. The el pastor tacos weren't so great, traditional el pastor is finely cut and they were in chunks here and not as tender/soft as it should be. But lucky for me my boyfriend ordered that so I did enjoy the borracho shrimp tacos! Glad I stumbled across this place while visiting
author: Michelle P.

description:
As most "Mexican" Restaurants in SF.....
Overpriced and over rated.....
How are 3 tacos 10 bucks???? 
Really??? 
The place was empty and yet the service was slow....
The tacos were small, for the price, tacos should never be over 1.50..... NEVER!!!! I don't care how much meat you put in them, it's never over 1.50!!!!
Here they charged double and it still suck!
The pozole was ok......
And yet it took about 10 min to get to us in an empty place....
Wow, what a let down....
99% of most restaurants in SF are overated and over priced, this place is proof of it!!!!
Make that trek to the Mission and make sure the owners are Mexicans or at least Latinos.....
What a let down.....'
We need to shut places like these down!
author: Jose A. P.

description: Stopped in for a early lunch to escape the crowds. My friend and I were greeted and seated quickly. We were the only two in the restaurant. We ordered some chips and salsa that were very tasty. I ordered the steak enchiladas and was disappointed in the flavor. Bland, very bland is the best way to describe it. Also the food took a really long time. We were still the only people in the restaurant and it took forever. If you are looking for a fast lunch or some flavorful Mexican food I would go elsewhere. This place is more of a hipster joint and if you eat here stick with chips and salsa.
author: Eggsnham S.

description:
Great tacos, and a good vibe. Stylish without going overboard.

Convenient, outdoor seating, and a decent menu of cocktails.
author: Jim N.

description: Great ambience, service, food and bar drinks! We tried many different tacos- The steak taco was a little tough to chew but we loved all the others especially the barbacoa
author: Alona G.

description: I love this place, it's a little pricey but it's delicious and they make the best margarita ever!
author: Erin H.

description: This was our first visit to this restaurant.  We started with chips and salsa trio which was pretty typical for Mexican restaurants.  The fundido was a chorizo mixture with cheese on top.  It was different than other fundidos we've had and not necessarily in a good way.  We ordered carnitas tacos, fish tacos and the beet salad.  Probably the best thing we ordered was the salad.  The tacos were chocked full of meat, just average for our taste.  No iced tea was available, so we drank water since we don't drink alcohol at dinner.  We ate out on the street which was plenty warm under the heater even though it was cold and raining.
author: Rob C.

description: Stellar tequila, killer tacos and spicy salsa. My kinda place. They even have a weekend brunch. You will really be happy you chose to eat here
author: Shari B.

description: Casual and exactly what we were looking for- immediately seated and enjoyed a beer with chips/salsa/guac before our main courses-all tasty & good portions--not too overpriced.  Friendly staff-super clean environment.  Seating is close together but not cramped enough to hear your neighbors' conversation.
author: Denise K.

description: Amazing food, ambiance, and most important, drinks. The guac is delicious, as well as all the tacos. Have been several times, can't wait to return!
author: Charlotte C.

description: Stopped for lunch after union square/market street  walk.  Salsa trio great starter. Not too hot. Each unique -Smokey chipotle. Etc... Carnita and brisket tacos outstanding.  Well deserving of 4 stars or more.
author: Andrew K.

description: Where do I begin? Went in there for restaurant week... On the restaurant week website it says Matador is participating in lunch and dinner. The server said we were mistaken, it's only for dinner. No big deal, we order off the menu. My companion wants 2 different types of tacos, 2 of one kind, 1 of another. NOT POSSIBLE. You have to get a minimum of 2 of each type of taco. I can't understand why you MUST order a minimum of 2 of each type. Then I ask for salsa with my taco... The server says "that's $3 extra." WTF I've never heard of paying an extra $3 for salsa. The food itself was decent. Wish they had more vegetarian options. Ambiance was cool.
author: Joe Z.

description: amazing! Very friendly and all about to customer here. Would defiantly recommend for everyone to come and stop by!
author: Juju C.

description: 3 stars only because I asked for my steak tacos medium well versus the medium rare, which is how they come & unfortunately i still got medium rare. I was not able to finish them. Which has never been an issue for me when it comes to yummy street tacos. On a positive note their red michelada was hands down the best michi I have ever had. Would definitely go back again and maybe try the chicken tacos the next time which my boyfriend really enjoyed.
author: Lorena A.

description: I'm giving it 2 stars because the only good thing about this place were the drinks. Our server was so rude and walked away mid conversations. Talked as she walked away. The tacos were full of fat and greasy and the tortillas were hard and cold. We didn't even eat them at all. Definitely will not be coming back.  Told the server we didn't like the tacos they were not good if we could pay half and she said no, you have to pay for them. Smh. Worse service and food.....if you want good drinks come here but definitely not the food or service.
author: Sandra M.

description: Great spot...steak quesadilia was delicious.  Looks like it might get busier later but glad we stopped in even though it was pretty empty.
author: Shannon R.

description: The food is pretty good, if overpriced. The service is ok, and $3 for club soda is highway robbery. I won't be back.
author: Jess N.

description: Love the food, ambiance, and frozen margaritas. However service is really slow. Particularly when you are relegated to sitting at the bar and waiting for someone to notice you. Please hire extra staff. Experienced this almost every time I've been here.
author: Fawn B.

description: We were attending an event in Union Square and decided to find a local restaurant for a late lunch and drinks.  We found this restaurant on Yelp and were not disappointed.  The ambiance was very nice and the servers were friendly.  The spicy margaritas were great.  And the food was EXCELLENT!  Especially the carnitas tacos.  They were a little under-staffed the day we frequented the restaurant, but the food more than made up for the slight delay.  I highly recommend.  Can't wait to visit again.
author: Olivia P.

description: Food was good, wait was quick and they even have an old flick on for viewing. Def get the chicken empanadas
author: Brandon K.

description: Literally the worst dining experience I had in SF. Waiter clearly didn't want us to order, walking away before taking orders of everyone in the group. Food was ok. After a $60 dinner for 3 people we are going home to cook. If you come here, go somewhere else.
author: Maksim P.

description: I was pleasantly surprised with Matador when I wandered in for lunch on a weekday. My boyfriend and I each had soup (I had Pozole), split 3 tacos, and the enchiladas verde platter. Everything was so flavorful and authentic tasting. The service was a bit slow, but I'd still definitely go back. I had to work after, otherwise I would have ordered one of their famous margaritas!
author: Kim O.

description: The food was good!!! But the service was horrible!! Everything was with an attitude by the server. Never smiled and seemed like she didn't want to be there.. We would have ordered more food and drinks but we couldn't with all that attitude..
author: Ebrambil B.

description:
I'd like to start off by saying I'm from Central California so I know what good Mexican food tastes like.  

My Story....I was on vacation and was craving a beer, I went in for the beer and ended up having a couple of tacos with that beer, it was the best decision I ever made!

Guacamole & Chips were amazing!
Carnitas Tacos were amazing!
Service was amazing!

I Highly recommend this place.  Next time I am in SF, I will definitely be back.
author: Gary G.

description:
Growing up eating latin foods, I alway look for a good restaurant nearby. The first time I had eaten here was nearly two months ago, I was excited to have a Spanish restaurant in the neighborhood. After I bit into my fish taco though, it lacked flavor or should I say flavor that I am use to. The pozole was a little better but still lacked those classic flavors that I am use to--though I do understand that in each region in Latin America, they have their own version of Pozole. 

So, after a long day at school, I decided to give them another try. I was greeted nicely, and I was allowed to chose a table. After I sat down though, I was quickly forgotten, despite the restaurant not being that busy. After a very long wait (I had almost gotten up an left), the host finally gave me a menu. I looked through it carefully this time and I really had my heart set on the spare-ribs, along with giving the pozole another try. After another long wait the server/host finally took my order where she then proceeded to dash my cravings, they didn't have the spare-ribs for what ever reason. Instead, I ended up ordering the pozole, despite not having the spare-ribs, and the Shrimp Cocktail. The Shrimp Cocktail surprised me and actually had complexity and a kick but then the pozole came. Normally I would be ok when a restaurant gets my order wrong, I had order a cup of pozole, instead they brought me a bowl. After the first bit, I wanted to send it back. Not the pozole that I am use to, but even still, there was something about it that did not agree with me, maybe it was how they make it. If you really want Pozole that I am use to or how my mother use to make it then go to Tlaloc in the financial district. Now they know how to make flavorful food with personality that awakes in your mouth...

Overall for me it is a hit or miss with the food. The service though definitely needs improving...to make my point, I had ordered another strawberry-lemonde, which is all ice and very little drink for $5.00, I didn't get my second drink until after I had paid for my bill. My server apologized and the barback asked if I still wanted it. "I paid for it, so yes I do." They gave it to me in a coffee cup to go. : (
author: Tlielaxu M.

description: Killer tacos, awesome drink selection, cool vibe. Matador is one of those places that, when you find, you can't shut up about. Get the Mulita and the turkey tacos!
author: Joel W.

description:
Overpriced and Inconsistent!  

2 small bland street tacos per order x 2
3 partially filled drinks
1 tiny chips and watery salsa
1 tasteless, miniscule guacamole

Nearly $100!!!!  WTF?!?!?!

OK, I've been here a few times.  This is the first time for a full meal.  It has only been open a month and they are already seriously cutting corners and have revised the menu to increase the prices while decreasing the amount of food/drink.  Unacceptable!

First off, they charge $3 for chips and salsa.  Unacceptable!  The "bucket" of chips they bring is no larger than one of those small bags at a corner store.  The chips originally were thick, substantial and filling.  Now they are thin and low grade and a shocking small portion.

Second, the drinks come only 75% to 80% full.  At first I thought it was a fluke but since each one came that way one after the other I guess that is the policy.  Bad form/manner in which to save a few pennies on $10+ drinks!  Rip off!

Third, BOTH the frozen drinks and those made by hand a VERY inconsistent.  They range from great to unpalatable.  When was the last time you had to send a drink back....pretty rare but this warranted it. 

The frozen strawberry marg from the machine was bitter/tart and not slushy. I advised them of this and saw that they added more strawberry liquid to the machine to fix it.  They took the drink they served to me 75% full in the first place with several sips now missing and dumped it into another glass then mixed in more strawberry by hand.  Seriously?!?!?  Why not serve a NEW, fresh, "fixed" and FULL drink from the machine you just added the strawberry mix to?!?   The new glass was not even a margarita glass.  It was a water glass and once more had no flavored rim.  I got back about 70% of a drink.  Insultingly cheap and passive aggressive???  


Fourth, the $8 guacamole was merely a small dish with a scoop of guac made essentially of NOTHING more than a barely smashed chunky avocado.  There was no flavor and the serving was insultingly small. Think the size of a small ice-cream scoop......for $8!? 


Fifth, why are they charging for chips and "salsa"?!?!  OK, if you are going to do so then offer something special and/or a serving size that is not insultingly small with watery, thin "dips/salsas." The green "salsa" was too thin to "stick" to the chips and the chunky pico was swimming in a pool of clear liquid. Gross. 

Sixth, price changes seem to happen all too often.  They used to charge $10 for a frozen margarita.  This was 4-6 weeks ago when they opened.  It was strong and flavorful and the glass was served FULL.  Now, the same drink is $13, weak/inconsistent and they only fill the glass 80% of the way with no chili salt/sugar rim as originally offered.

Seventh, the steak tacos had ZERO flavor and the meat was thin, luke warm and the portion small.  It reminded me of left overs from the night before that you eat the next day with a hangover.....just a tiny tasteless pile of meat on a tortilla.  

Everything here seems to be geared towards serving as little as possible in both the food and drink portions and over charging for each item....by A LOT!  

When was the last time you had marginal street tacos, chips and a partially full drink or two for two people at lunch for almost $100?!?!?!   

I get the feeling they are already barely hanging on and will close soon....even though they only opened a month or so ago.  I could go down the street to Campton Place and have AWESOME drinks and food at a 5 star hotel bar for less than what it cost here for meager pours and small portions.  Why bother?!  

I live here in SF.  I won't be back and will advise others not to waste their time/money. 

The only stand out was the service, which was extremely friendly and accommodating.  But, this was one individual setting her own standards against the rest of the BS described above decided by management.
author: John B.

description: My boyfriend and myself came here a few weeks ago and absolutely fell in love. The food was so good... the salsa alone was something I would come back for. Usually I'm super picky, but I loved it. My boyfriend is a huge foodie and is in the culinary industry and he loved the tacos he got, he said the meat was amazing. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone. Also, the drinks were so cute and SO good.
author: Cass S.

description: Wonderful great Mexican food. Clean, juicy and delicious. It is one of the best in the city. (*^_^*)
author: Yumi K.

description: The tacos are indeed good. But they don't justify the price tag, shabby decor and indifferent-bordering-on-rude service. For a simple taco joint, it is over priced. For a regular restaurant, it is underwhelming. I presented my yelp coupon for complimentary chips & salsa, which was accepted, but when the bill came, it was charged! It's not kid friendly, which does not surprise me in downtown, but there are many chic and upmarket places where the waiters have been very gracious with my very well behaved 5-yr old. I went there based on the yelp reviews only to be disappointed.
author: Priya K.

description: Great simple tacos with bold flavors. Beautiful decor and great service. Definitely would come here again if I was in town. A little noisy but that is to be expected in a small space. I recommend the steak tacos and their verde salsa was delicious!
author: Delainy G.

description:
This place is lovely inside, very modern and attractive place! The staff are lovely and very helpful!
However, the food leaves a lot to be desired, for the amount you pay you get very little food with even less flavour! I got the chicken tacos, it took 25 minutes to prepare and serve and it was gone in under 2 minutes! The chicken was tasteless and very fatty, the accompanying sauce was just a decoration, there was no kick to it, just something to fill the plate! I had the strawberry lemonade, it's fantastic was probably the tastiest thing I had in there!
author: Claire C.

description: I had the queso fondido along with three Barbacoa tacos.  The queso fondido was great!  It has some of my favorite things in it (corn and mushrooms) - and they're in cheese!  How much better does it get than that?!?! :) The barbacoa tacos were meaty and tasty as well!  Not much fat on the meat, which made me happy!  Corn tortillas with the tacos and queso were excellent.  I'll be back!
author: Matt E.

description: really good tacos, chips and salsa. my carnitas were a little oily, but this may have been enhanced because i got them plain. i liked the decor and aesthetics.
author: Kimberly P.

description: Definitley 5 stars hands down . Me and my hunny went in last weekend and we really liked the music , the drinks and most importantly the food. We were a little skeptical because were are from L.A and didnt know if the Mexican food would actually taste authentic but it sure did and we will be returing when we are back in SF.
author: Evelyn U.

description: Great neighborhood place to get tacos! Definitely enjoyed my time there and the food! Service was great as well. Definitely recommend for lunch!
author: Bruno T.

description: Awesome new restaurant. Really beautiful interior. Shrimp and queso tacos won the day. Cocktail game on point. Service A+. Will be back!
author: Atlee C.

description: Pleasantly surprised. Food quality is excellent. Service is great too. Would definitely come back with friends. You can tell chef Ray is classically trained; his French training mixed with his Northern Mexican roots combines in a really nice way.
author: Jojo G.

description: Last night, after 3 years of living in SF, I finally found my "go to" spot. My manners went out the window when their queso with chorizo came to the table. It took everything in me not to lick the ramekin. Hands down the best queso dish I've ever tried (and I've tried plenty). It's not  your standard homogeneous queso, instead, it's huge chunks of perfectly-seasoned chorizo, corn, pablano chilies, and mushrooms topped with melted cheese. It comes with tortillas, but we asked for chips, too. We also tried the tacos de matador (beef brisket), camarones a la diabla (spicy shrimp), and tacos borrachos (battered fish), all of which were divine. These tacos make Tacolicious look like child's play. (Sorry Tacolicious, you were alright, but I've found someone new.) Each of the tacos were unique and all were bursting with flavor...I'm salivating just thinking about them. I also tried their pear margarita and Jamaica sour (a hibiscus tequila drink), and loved them both. It was my first time at this restaurant, but every single thing I tried was absolutely delicious, start to finish. We were lucky enough to have Pablo taking care of us, who made great recommendations, was friendly, and didn't pass judgement as we ordered our third round of tacos! Matador is a winner in my book, so if you even remotely like tacos (are you human?!), give this place a try!
author: Kristin H.

description: This place is new but they are already one of my favorite spots in my neighborhood! The service is excellent, the food is really good and the atmosphere is very comfortable and cool. I know it's hard to get into paying a little more for fancy Mexican food but it's totally worth it!
author: Robin A.

description: Good food. Cool looking place. Staff disorganized. Forgot our order. Grr.
author: Brian W.

description: I'd come from anywhere in California for the Matador's tacos! The classic margarita is straightforward no nonsense with great tasting tequila. The queso fundido is amazing. This is the coolest and most tasty taco and tequila place in SF! Must eat if you are in the city!
author: Nate Z.

description: Yeah, I don't give Mexican restaurants 5 star reviews.  In fact I don't give many 5 star reviews at all.  But Matador earned it in every way.  Clean, modern upscale decor.  Excellent, attentive service.  Most importantly, the best real Mexican food you'll get this side of Mexico City.  I had carnitas tacos that were simply exceptional.  My friend had enchiladas that were magnificent.  Cold beer.  Great appetizers.  I'm sorry I don't live in SF; this would be a regular stop for me.
author: James T.

description: Awesome drinks and nice atmosphere! Plus there's a really cute waiter named Luis that works there!
author: Liz M.

description: Amazing food and service as well.  The beef brisket (Matador) tacos are super tasty.  Overall I would say this is the best place I know of to get Mexican food in the Nob Hill neighborhood and one of the better restaurants in the city.  Prices are also very reasonable.
author: Benjamin B.

description: Mexican food that is more than the typical taqueria, meaning they double as a tequila bar! The food is quite good, portions are smaller than most typical Mexican places, but the bartenders are friendly and it's a nice change from the other places around the lower nob hill / union square area.
author: N A.

description: The tacos are great but you can't mix and match them which kind of sucks (need to get 2 or 3 of the same). The margaritas are also really tasty but seem to be very little in alcohol. I barely got buzzed off 3 margaritas and I am a light weight. If drinks were stronger it would be 5 stars
author: Ida Z.

description: Our group dined at Matador on 11/21 for our last lunch on vacation. The food was absolutely amazing and the drinks were mixed properly. I would have given 4 stars if it wasn't for our horrible service. There were only about 5 tables that had other patrons and it was early afternoon, around 12:30 or so, however our server seemed completely out of it. We had to stop her to let her know we were ready to order drinks after about 15 minutes of waiting, and once we began to place our order, she informed us that we had an old drink menu and that none of the drinks we wanted were available. When asked why she would give us a menu that isn't current, she said "Hold on" and ran to the back. She then came back and said that all the drinks actually WERE available, and that there was a mix up. About 20 minutes later we had to flag her down AGAIN to say that we were ready to finally order, which seemed to irritate her. I tried to order the barbacoa tacos, and she informed me that they had run out. That excuse seemed odd, as they had just opened at 11:30, but I accepted it because I don't run restaurants, and it is possible that they could have ran out from the evening before. It took another 30 minutes to get our food, but we didn't complain because everything we each ordered was amazing. As we were getting ready to depart, I overheard the table next to us order the barbacoa tacos, and she never mentioned that they didn't have the meat, and actually complimented the patron on ordering it because it was her favorite on the menu. It would have been an amazing experience, if it wasn't for the waitress. It felt as if she didn't want to serve our table, which is unfortunate. At one point, the bartender had to deliver our drinks from the bar because they had been sitting there for so long. Would love to go back, but if that same waitress is there, I would probably leave.
author: Ky B.

description:
We stumbled here on a Monday night after the wait somewhere else was too long. 

Home made chips, salsas, and guacamole plus a signature margarita? Yes , please!

The soap ranchera was flavorful and I could have it alone for a meal but we also had tacos. If you're a fan of street style tacos this is your place. We had the carnitas and barbacoa with their own special sauces. Muy deliciosos. 

The service was fast and friendly.
author: Sarah V.

description: Ordered the carnitas tacos and they were fantastic. The drinks are creative and tasty and the churros are a nice treat to order at the end of a meal if you're in the mood for something sweet.
author: Gene S.

description: Such an upscale.place than what was shown klor even advertised! Great food and friendly staff and good eats. What more do you need?
author: Luke B.

description: At first when I noticed the menu had no burritos, the thought that crossed my mind was "What kind of Mexican" restaurant is this but the food redeemed itself. I ordered the crab meat tacos and they were awesome! Also has some al pastor tacos and they hit the spot! Overall is was good Mexican food coming from a Mexican!
author: Marco V.

description: Chilaquiles where not good nor appealing and that is their best dish for brunch :/ makes you wonder how the rest of the food tastes.
author: Rachel O.

description: Friendly staff, AMAZING cocktail selections and the food is delicious! I think I just found my go to spot when I'm in the city!
author: America R.

description: Had our "after wedding lunch" here and it was great! They were very accommodating! We didn't have an rsvp but everything was perfect. Service and food was excellent. Would highly recommend this establishment.
author: Krista D.

description: Cocktail menu is on point and the passion fruit margarita is a flavor explosion in your mouth. The place is tiny but super cute and they play old movies on the wall. The tacos were delicious and the guacamole was very fresh.
author: Sandy H.

description: These tacos are phenomenal. Best I have ever tasted. Carnitas was the winner for me, but all were delicious. Great margaritas, too. I really wish I lived closer to this spot.
author: Guillermo E.

description: Matador does not have many vegetarian options. And the food they do have had a strange hipster twist to authentic Mexican food. You don't get free chips and salsa (what kind of "Mexican" restaurant does that??). I had the fish tacos and they were really disgusting and not filling at all. A side of rice and beans was $8. That's ridiculous. I went with one other person and we spent forty bucks, and I went home still hungry (didn't ask the other person If they were hungry though).
author: Meghan H.

description: The decor is nice and trendy.The tacos were good a bit on the spicy side but should be expected. We ordered a few taco plates they were good but the Queso Fundido was delicious. I would say the place is a bit pricey but it's relative to the location and look. The waitress had an attitude at times, almost snobbish and towards the end of the night she brought us the bill way before it time to close indicating we should leave. All in all the food was good.
author: Talia H.

description: Killer margaritas!!! And you can order them by the pitcher!!!! Love the atmosphere, especially when it's warm and they open the front of the restaurant to the sidewalk. Classic Spanish movies silently projected onto the wall add a interesting touch too. But seriously, those margaritas....
author: Christina L.

description: The decor is nice but that's about all I can compliment them on. We stopped for a quick lunch and were the only two people in the place but everything we ordered took forever to arrive and our main dishes, two kinds of enchiladas, were average at best if not completely boring. Nothing to rave about at all. Service absolutely horrible. Lots of staff meandering about but not sure what they were doing.
author: Joy W.

description: Good food and service overall.  There is a downside though,  they do Not take AMEX cards as of March 2016
author: Baruch F.

description: Very tasty and enjoyable food. Generally great place. I read reviews about the service, but generally when people give bad ratings for service it annoys me - how do you know they're always like that or if the waiter is having a bad day, or just annoyed by the customer. Anyway, my service was just fine. And would totally recommend the Matador Tacos and the pulled pork was fantastic. I didn't care for the Brussels sprouts though, and I love them but didn't really care for the flavor choice. Why does every restaurant think they need a Brussels sprout dish? Anyway, I'd eat here again anytime.
author: Jason R.

description: The Matador is a keeper. Get the frozen margarita!  I got the tacos (barbacoa) and the corn side dish! Delish!   I will be back again.
author: Scott W.

description: The carnitas are amazing along with the fresh guacamole. The Matador margaritas were an experience all on it's own. Definitely get the pitcher if you are with someone, better value. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Relaxed atmosphere.
author: Matthew G.

description:
Delicious food and drinks, quick seating and attentive service. Love the atmosphere and the chicken-wild mushroom empanadas. Can't wait to go back. We shared everything including a generous tamarind champagne cocktail. The spicy shrimp tacos were perfectly offset by the creamy Esquite, a  lovely corn dish with queso cotija.

Bring your friends and try everything.
author: K. M.

description: Fun atmosphere, cold beer, very good red sangria, my pseudo wife/girl friend loved the shredded beef tacos and I enjoyed the Al Pastor tacos. We also shared the fried avocado tacos. We'll definitely come back on our next visit to San Francisco. Thanks Yelp for showing us the way to the Matador.
author: WTroy B.

description: Was in town looking for a good fish taco and stumbled on this place! Everything we ordered was Amazing!!!! And our server Joleen was super friendly and personable.  We also had our 8 month old baby with us and she made us feel very welcome!
author: Mary E.

description: In town on business and I stumbled upon this place thinking it was the Matador from the Seattle area...it wasn't but they treated me great. Margaritas were slamming and guac was tasty. Didn't eat just  had a couple of drinks and the staff was super friendly.
author: Jana E.

description: Thought this place was great.  Not only did they have my favorite tequila, but the "tequila master" was very helpful and knowledgeable.  Food was excellent as I love tacos and the vibe was really good too.
author: Brian M.

description: False Advertising.  The restaurant advertised a fixed price menu on the SF Restaurant Week website (http://www.sfrestaurantweek.com/restaurants/), but did not honor the advertisement.
author: Micah G.

description: Matador is a great locale for casual food, excellent tacos (so flavorful, dynamic), awesome guac, and refreshing cocktails. Our service (Lindsay C) was top notch! It was the perfect end to our day.
author: Maria S.

description: I'd like to give this 4 stars, but unfortunately the service was a huge turnoff. We got our appetizers before we even got our drinks! Took a while for the servers to notice us, and take our order. It wasn't even that busy. The food was good, someone got the 2 fish tacos, with a side of corn and beans, while the other got one of the salads. Chips and guac were alright. They didn't serve us the salsa and when asked to make the guac spicier our waitress told us that wasn't possible, but we asked another server if we could and she gave us hot sauce which is basically all we were asking for. On the pricier side of mexican too.
author: Deborah G.

description: Just absolutely delicious!   Had the Matador tacos, the pork el Pastor, the chicken enchiladas and quesadilla...all outstanding. Came at an off hour in the afternoon, so not too busy.  Service was great...thank you Nicolas!  Come try this place out!
author: Fickle O.

description:
We decided to eat here because our original plan for a restaurant was super packed and I enjoy Mexican food. 

The decor and atmosphere seemed nice but the food was definitely lacking. Ordered the shrimp tacos, chicken tacos, guac and chips, and a side of corn. The description for the tacos sounded nice but it sure didn't taste like it. The chicken was dry and the shrimp was bland. The accompaniments in the tacos felt lost. The guacamole and corn were okay, nothing special. The server also seemed like he was lacking in experience.
author: Brian C.

description: Rude and disrespectful.  When we were waiting on a table of three  without explanation or apology. Not the way we want to spend our evening or our money.
author: Shari S.

description:
Awesome! Inventive Mexican menu with large
variety of unique margaritas and soft tacos on homemade tortillas. Great salsa trio with chips. Also loved the green salad with pepitas and aquite corn side. Would definitely come back!
author: Lisa T.

description: Someone else wrote the service was bad here, but I gotta say, I thought the service was excellent. Tasty drinks, pretty good tacos. Nice place.
author: Denise N.

description: My husband and I live nearby and crave food Mexican but can't always trek to the Mission. This is so much better and more authentic that Tacolicious. We will add this spot to our rotation for sure! Certainty a plus that they have a great happy hour and project football games. Perfect for a Monday or Thursday night.... maybe even Sunday brunch... we'll be sure to try it out!
author: Kelly R.

description: This restaurant is a real find. Cozy space, full of lively music and black-and-white movies. Shared trios of tacos with two friends.  Carnitas, rock cod, and beef brisket. All were made with very fresh ingredients, and were each stuffed full. Enjoyed one of their special margaritas, and a glass of their house red wine. Made room for a delicious triple berry bread pudding. We will be back, this is just the kind of place this area needs.  Don't forget to order the guacamole. It's excellent.
author: Paula W.

description: Amazing food and atmosphere!!! Our party tried the tacos, enchiladas, and quesadilla. Every bite was gone and some even licked the plates. Great cocktails also!!! This is a must try!!!
author: Emma C.

description: Great new place very close to Union. Great food, good cocktails, great service and very modest prices. We'll be back for sure!!
author: Amnon R.

description: Great tacos, great service, were vacationing and this is one of the best places we ate at so far, two thumbs up.
author: Jennifer P.

description: This place was beyond amazing!  They accommodated my large party of 8, while spoiling us with incredible food, fabulous service, and a sweet surprise for the birthday boy that we came to San Francisco for!  We ate a variety of tacos, and all came with the expression #besttacosever and two different enchiladas were also devoured.  We highly recommend this restaurant!  Enjoy!!
author: Amanda C.

description: This is exactly the type of restaurant the city needs. It's a fun, casual environment but makes for a great night out if you're flying solo, with your significant other or in a group. I love the small plates since it allows you to try a few different things. The tacos are all top notch but I think the fried chicken and battered shrimp are my favorites. The guacamole is freshly made and is a perfect balance of all the flavors involved. And the margaritas are so fresh and crisp (the prickly pear is my favorite) that you can almost imagine you're on a beach in Baja and not the 57 degree fog in August ;)
author: San Fran G.

description: The food is amazing and I've never had Mexican food in the US that tasted this great. Come here for lunch, since the chef switches for dinner, and you will love it. The service attitude could be a little better but the quality of the food makes up for it.
author: John C.

description: Excellent margaritas and dishes. Guac and chips tasty and best carnitas tacos. Great ambience, too.
author: Kristin L.

description: The green michelada here was totally amazing. The food was not that great. I had the pollo tacos and felt that the consistency of the chicken was a bit off. Maybe the pescado tacos would have been better.  I do like the laid-back ambiance of this place though and would recommend it for drinks.
author: Lindsey L.

description: Expensive for the portion size and quality. The steak tacos were dry and hard to chew. Service was slow and got some orders wrong...
author: Norb N.

description: My husband and I were in the Union Square area around lunchtime and decided to branch out from our usual go to Mexican restaurants in the city. We found Matador on Yelp, and given its good rating, decided to try it out. We ordered  guacamole, salad, carnitas tacos (his), breakfast tacos (mine), and beans. The food was good, but I received an incorrect order 3 times and we never got our salad. The runner even delivered the same incorrect order to our table twice. I informed him that that was not my order, he told me that I needed to talk to my waiter. Even if the food was out of this world delicious, I don't know that I would risk going back.
author: Jessica J.

description: Great food at a reasonable price and stylish atmosphere. The waiter was fun and very attentive. Carnitas and Barbacoa were absolutely delicious!!
author: Jillian Z.

description: This was one of my favorite meals on my San Francisco trip. We were in the mood for Mexican and came across this spot while Yelping. We went for a late dinner and were seated right away without a reservation. The restaurant had a nice modern vibe. The food was great. We used the Yelp offer for the complimentary salsa. We ordered guac, fried chicken tacos, and the steak tacos. For dessert we went with the churros - why not treat ourselves on vacation. Everything was delicious. We tried the prickly pear margarita. That was one of my favorite margaritas I've ever had. The service was also great. It was our waiter's first day but he did a good job and the other staff quickly helped our needs with refilling our water glasses and giving us more chips. The restaurant and bar area still had a nice size crowd after 10pm. I would definitely recommend this place if you're looking for some tacos and a great margarita for a good value!
author: Nancy K.

description: My friend and I came here on Thursday afternoon looking to have few drinks and eat. They do not have much to eat on the menu. We just had couple drinks. Their margaritas are great but service needs to be better.
author: Freddy F.

description: Apparently this restaurant just opened not too long ago, so we figured we'd check it out. Who doesn't love tacos and fun cocktails.  The tacos were flavorful and just a heads up you get two with each order. So if lure starving you'll probably make your way through the menu.  I really enjoyed the cocktails, the pear and mezcal ones were my favorite. The mezcal wasn't too smoky, which I liked.
author: Anisha A.

description: Met a friend for dinner here. It was pretty full so we had dinner at the bar. Lenny was our bartender and he was so nice and helpful. He suggested great food choices and made us bomb margaritas. I highly suggest the ahi tuna tacos. And a chili rim on ur margarita. Delish! Definitely  coming back.
author: Lani B.

description: Awesome place. Just opened a few days ago, and I would highly recommend it. Awesome food and environment!
author: John G.
